167  , m_cur_sample_rate(-1)
168  , m_cur_channel_layout(0)
169  , m_audio_resample_ctx(nullptr)

171  , m_sws_ctx(nullptr)
172  , m_buffer_sink_context(nullptr)

191 FFmpeg_Transcoder::~FFmpeg_Transcoder()

199 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_video() const
200 {
201  bool is_video = false;
202 
203  if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
204  {
205  if (is_album_art(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec_id))
206  {
207  is_video = false;
208 
209  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->r_frame_rate.den)
210  {
211  double dbFrameRate = static_cast<double>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->r_frame_rate.num) / m_in.m_video.m_stream->r_frame_rate.den;
212 
213  // If frame rate is < 100 fps this should be a video
214  if (dbFrameRate < 100)
215  {
216  is_video = true;
217  }
218  }
219  }
220  else
221  {
222  // If the source codec is not PNG or JPG we can safely assume it's a video stream
223  is_video = true;
224  }
225  }
226 
227  return is_video;
228 }
229 
230 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::is_open() const
231 {
232  return (m_in.m_format_ctx != nullptr);
233 }
234 
235 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_input_file(LPVIRTUALFILE virtualfile, FileIO *fio)
236 {
237  AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
238  int ret;
239 
240  if (virtualfile == nullptr)
241  {
242  Logging::error(filename(), "INTERNAL ERROR in open_input_file(): virtualfile is NULL.");
243  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
244  }
245 
246  m_virtualfile = virtualfile;
247 
248  m_in.m_filename = m_virtualfile->m_origfile;
249  m_mtime = m_virtualfile->m_st.st_mtime;
250  m_current_format = params.current_format(m_virtualfile);
251 
252  if (is_open())
253  {
254  Logging::warning(filename(), "File is already open.");
255  return 0;
256  }
257 
258  // This allows selecting if the demuxer should consider all streams to be
259  // found after the first PMT and add further streams during decoding or if it rather
260  // should scan all that are within the analyze-duration and other limits
261 
262  ret = av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "scan_all_pmts", "1", AV_DICT_DONT_OVERWRITE);
263  if (ret < 0)
264  {
265  return ret;
266  }
267 
268  // ret = av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "avioflags", "direct", AV_DICT_DONT_OVERWRITE);
269  // if (ret < 0)
270  // {
271  // return ret;
272  // }
273 
274  // defaults to 5,000,000 microseconds = 5 seconds.
275  // ret = av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "analyzeduration", "5000000", 0); // <<== honored
276  // if (ret < 0)
277  // {
278  // return ret;
279  // }
280 
281  // 5000000 by default.
282  ret = av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "probesize", "15000000", 0); // <<== honoured;
283  if (ret < 0)
284  {
285  return ret;
286  }
287 
288  // using own I/O
289  if (fio == nullptr)
290  {
291  // Open new file io
292  m_fileio = FileIO::alloc(m_virtualfile->m_type);
293  m_close_fileio = true; // do not close and delete
294  }
295  else
296  {
297  // Use already open file io
298  m_fileio = fio;
299  m_close_fileio = false; // must not close or delete
300  }
301 
302  if (m_fileio == nullptr)
303  {
304  int _errno = errno;
305  Logging::error(filename(), "Error opening file: (%1) %2", errno, strerror(errno));
306  return AVERROR(_errno);
307  }
308 
309  ret = m_fileio->open(m_virtualfile);
310  if (ret)
311  {
312  return AVERROR(ret);
313  }
314 
315  m_in.m_format_ctx = avformat_alloc_context();
316  if (m_in.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
317  {
318  Logging::error(filename(), "Out of memory opening file: Unable to allocate format context.");
319  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
320  }
321 
322  unsigned char *iobuffer = static_cast<unsigned char *>(::av_malloc(m_fileio->bufsize() + FF_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE));
323  if (iobuffer == nullptr)
324  {
325  Logging::error(filename(), "Out of memory opening file: Unable to allocate I/O buffer.");
326  avformat_free_context(m_in.m_format_ctx);
327  m_in.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
328  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
329  }
330 
331  AVIOContext * pb = avio_alloc_context(
332  iobuffer,
333  static_cast<int>(m_fileio->bufsize()),
334  0,
335  static_cast<void *>(m_fileio),
336  input_read,
337  nullptr, // input_write
338  seek); // input_seek
339  m_in.m_format_ctx->pb = pb;
340 
341  // m_in.m_format_ctx->probesize = 15000000;
342 
343  AVInputFormat * infmt = nullptr;
344 
345 #ifdef USE_LIBVCD
346  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_VCD)
347  {
348  Logging::debug(filename(), "Forcing mpeg format for VCD source to avoid misdetections.");
349  infmt = av_find_input_format("mpeg");
350  }
351 #endif // USE_LIBVCD
352 #ifdef USE_LIBDVD
353  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
354  {
355  Logging::debug(filename(), "Forcing mpeg format for DVD source to avoid misdetections.");
356  infmt = av_find_input_format("mpeg");
357  }
358 #endif // USE_LIBDVD
359 #ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
360  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
361  {
362  Logging::debug(filename(), "Forcing mpegts format for Bluray source to avoid misdetections.");
363  infmt = av_find_input_format("mpegts");
364  }
365 #endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
366 
367  // Open the input file to read from it.
368  ret = avformat_open_input(&m_in.m_format_ctx, filename(), infmt, &opt);
369  if (ret < 0)
370  {
371  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not open input file (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
372  return ret;
373  }
374 
375  m_in.m_filetype = get_filetype_from_list(m_in.m_format_ctx->iformat->name);
376 
377  ret = av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "scan_all_pmts", nullptr, AV_DICT_MATCH_CASE, filename());
378  if (ret < 0)
379  {
380  return ret;
381  }
382 
383  AVDictionaryEntry * t = av_dict_get(opt, "", nullptr, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
384  if (t != nullptr)
385  {
386  Logging::error(filename(), "Option %1 not found.", t->key);
387  return (EOF); // Couldn't open file
388  }
389 
390 #if HAVE_AV_FORMAT_INJECT_GLOBAL_SIDE_DATA
391  av_format_inject_global_side_data(m_in.m_format_ctx);
392 #endif
393 
394  // Get information on the input file (number of streams etc.).
395  ret = avformat_find_stream_info(m_in.m_format_ctx, nullptr);
396  if (ret < 0)
397  {
398  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not find stream info (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
399  return ret;
400  }
401 
402 #ifdef USE_LIBDVD
403  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
404  {
405  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
406  m_in.m_format_ctx->duration = m_fileio->duration();
407  }
408 #endif // USE_LIBDVD
409 #ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
410  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
411  {
412  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from Bluray directory
413  m_in.m_format_ctx->duration = m_fileio->duration();
414  }
415 #endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
416 
417  // Open best match video codec
418  ret = open_bestmatch_codec_context(&m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, &m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, m_in.m_format_ctx, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO, filename());
419  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND) // Not an error
420  {
421  Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to open video codec (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
422  return ret;
423  }
424 
425  m_virtualfile->m_duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration;
426 
427  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx >= 0)
428  {
429  // We have a video stream
430  m_in.m_video.m_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx];
431 
432 #ifdef USE_LIBDVD
433  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
434  {
435  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
436  m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
437  }
438 #endif // USE_LIBDVD
439 #ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
440  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
441  {
442  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from Bluray
443  m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
444  }
445 #endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
446 
447  video_info(false, m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream);
448 
449  m_is_video = is_video();
450 
451 #ifdef AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED
452  if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->codec->capabilities & AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED)
453  {
454  m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->flags|= AV_CODEC_FLAG_TRUNCATED; // we do not send complete frames
455  }
456 #else
457 #warning "Your FFMPEG distribution is missing AV_CODEC_CAP_TRUNCATED flag. Probably requires fixing!"
458 #endif
459  }
460 
461  // Open best match audio codec
462  ret = open_bestmatch_codec_context(&m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, &m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, m_in.m_format_ctx, AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO, filename());
463  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_STREAM_NOT_FOUND) // Not an error
464  {
465  Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to open audio codec (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
466  return ret;
467  }
468 
469  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx >= 0)
470  {
471  // We have an audio stream
472  m_in.m_audio.m_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx];
473 
474 #ifdef USE_LIBDVD
475  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
476  {
477  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from IFO
478  m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
479  }
480 #endif // USE_LIBDVD
481 #ifdef USE_LIBBLURAY
482  if (m_virtualfile->m_type == VIRTUALTYPE_BLURAY)
483  {
484  // FFmpeg API calculcates a wrong duration, so use value from Bluray directory
485  m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
486  }
487 #endif // USE_LIBBLURAY
488 
489  audio_info(false, m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_audio.m_stream);
490  }
491 
492  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx == -1 && m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx == -1)
493  {
494  Logging::error(filename(), "File contains neither a video nor an audio stream.");
495  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
496  }
497 
498  // Predict size of transcoded file as exact as possible
499  m_virtualfile->m_predicted_size = calculate_predicted_filesize();
500 
501  // Calculate number or video frames in file based on duration and frame rate
502  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate.den)
503  {
504  // Number of frames: should be quite accurate
505  m_virtualfile->m_video_frame_count = static_cast<uint32_t>(av_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, av_inv_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate)));
506  }
507 
508  // Make sure this is set, although should already have happened
509  m_virtualfile->m_format_idx = params.guess_format_idx(filename());
510 
511  // Unfortunately it is too late to do this here, the filename has already been selected and cannot be changed.
512  // if (!params.smart_transcode())
513  // {
514  // // Not smart encoding: use first format (video file)
515  // m_virtualfile->m_format_idx = 0;
516  // }
517  // else
518  // {
519  // // Smart transcoding
520  // if (m_is_video)
521  // {
522  // // Is a video: use first format (video file)
523  // m_virtualfile->m_format_idx = 0;
524 
525  // Logging::debug(filename(), "Smart transcode: using video format.");
526  // }
527  // else
528  // {
529  // // For audio only, use second format (audio only file)
530  // m_virtualfile->m_format_idx = 1;
531 
532  // Logging::debug(filename(), "Smart transcode: using audio format.");
533  // }
534  // }
535 
536  // Open album art streams if present and supported by both source and target
537  if (!params.m_noalbumarts && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr &&
538  supports_albumart(m_in.m_filetype) && supports_albumart(get_filetype(m_current_format->desttype())))
539  {
540  Logging::trace(filename(), "Processing album arts.");
541 
542  for (int stream_idx = 0; stream_idx < static_cast<int>(m_in.m_format_ctx->nb_streams); stream_idx++)
543  {
544  AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_format_ctx->streams[stream_idx];
545  AVCodecID codec_id;
546 
547  codec_id = CODECPAR(input_stream)->codec_id;
548 
549  if (is_album_art(codec_id))
550  {
551  STREAMREF streamref;
552  AVCodecContext * input_codec_ctx;
553 
554  ret = open_codec_context(&input_codec_ctx, stream_idx, m_in.m_format_ctx, AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO, filename());
555  if (ret < 0)
556  {
557  Logging::error(filename(), "Failed to open album art codec (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
558  return ret;
559  }
560 
561  streamref.m_codec_ctx = input_codec_ctx;
562  streamref.m_stream = input_stream;
563  streamref.m_stream_idx = input_stream->index;
564 
565  m_in.m_album_art.push_back(streamref);
566  }
567  }
568  }
569 
570  return 0;
571 }
572 
573 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::can_copy_stream(const AVStream *stream) const
574 {
575  if (params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_OFF)
576  {
577  // Auto copy disabled
578  return false;
579  }
580 
581  if (stream == nullptr)
582  {
583  // Should normally not happen: Input stream stream unknown, no way to check - no auto copy
584  return false;
585  }
586 
587  if ((params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCH || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCHLIMIT))
588  {
589  // Any codec supported by output format OK
590  AVOutputFormat* oformat = av_guess_format(nullptr, destname(), nullptr);
591  if (oformat->codec_tag == nullptr ||
592  av_codec_get_tag(oformat->codec_tag, CODECPAR(stream)->codec_id) <= 0)
593  {
594  // Codec not supported - no auto copy
595  return false;
596  }
597  }
598  else if ((params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICT || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICTLIMIT))
599  {
600  // Output codec must strictly match
601  if (CODECPAR(stream)->codec_id != m_current_format->audio_codec_id())
602  {
603  // Different codecs - no auto copy
604  return false;
605  }
606  }
607 
608  if (params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_MATCHLIMIT || params.m_autocopy == AUTOCOPY_STRICTLIMIT)
609  {
610  BITRATE orig_bit_rate = (CODECPAR(stream)->bit_rate != 0) ? CODECPAR(stream)->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
611  if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, params.m_audiobitrate))
612  {
613  // Bit rate changed, no auto copy
614  Logging::info(destname(), "Bit rate changed, no auto copy possible.");
615  return false;
616  }
617  }
618 
619  return true;
620 }
621 
622 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_file(Buffer *buffer)
623 {
624  assert(buffer != nullptr);
625 
626  get_destname(&m_out.m_filename, m_in.m_filename);
627 
628  m_out.m_filetype = m_current_format->filetype();
629 
630  Logging::info(destname(), "Opening output file.");
631 
632  if (!is_frameset())
633  {
634  // Not a frame set, open regular buffer
635  return open_output(buffer);
636  }
637  else
638  {
639  Logging::debug(destname(), "Opening format type '%1'.", m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
640 
641  // Open frame set buffer
642  return open_output_frame_set(buffer);
643  }
644 }
645 
646 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_frame_set(Buffer *buffer)
647 {
648  AVCodec* codec = nullptr;
649  AVCodecContext* output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
650  int ret = 0;
651 
652  m_buffer = buffer;
653  {
654  std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lck (m_mutex);
655  while (m_seek_to_fifo.size())
656  {
657  m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
658  }
659  }
660  m_have_seeked = false;
661 
662  codec = avcodec_find_encoder(m_current_format->video_codec_id());
663  if (codec == nullptr)
664  {
665  Logging::error(destname(), "Codec not found");
666  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
667  }
668 
669  output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(codec);
670  if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
671  {
672  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate video codec context");
673  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
674  }
675 
676  output_codec_ctx->bit_rate = 400000;
677  output_codec_ctx->width = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->width;
678  output_codec_ctx->height = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->height;
679  output_codec_ctx->time_base = {1, 25};
680 
681  const AVPixFmtDescriptor *dst_desc = av_pix_fmt_desc_get(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->pix_fmt);
682  int loss = 0;
683 
684  output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = avcodec_find_best_pix_fmt_of_list(codec->pix_fmts, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->pix_fmt, dst_desc->flags & AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_ALPHA, &loss);
685 
686  if (output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt == AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
687  {
688  // No best match found, use default
689  switch (m_current_format->video_codec_id())
690  {
691  case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
692  {
693  output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P;
694  break;
695  }
696  case AV_CODEC_ID_PNG:
697  {
698  output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_RGB24;
699  break;
700  }
701  case AV_CODEC_ID_BMP:
702  {
703  output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = AV_PIX_FMT_BGR24;
704  break;
705  }
706  default:
707  {
708  assert(false);
709  break;
710  }
711  }
712  Logging::debug(destname(), "No best match output pixel format found, using default: %1", get_pix_fmt_name(output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt).c_str());
713  }
714  else
715  {
716  Logging::debug(destname(), "Output pixel format: %1", get_pix_fmt_name(output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt).c_str());
717  }
718 
719  //codec_context->sample_aspect_ratio = frame->sample_aspect_ratio;
720  //codec_context->sample_aspect_ratio = m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio;
721 
722  ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, codec, nullptr);
723  if (ret < 0)
724  {
725  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not open image codec.");
726  return ret;
727  }
728 
729  // Initialise pixel format conversion and rescaling if necessary
730 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
731  AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->format);
732 #else
733  AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->pix_fmt);
734 #endif
735  if (in_pix_fmt == AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
736  {
737  // If input's stream pixel format is unknown, use same as output (may not work but at least will not crash FFmpeg)
738  in_pix_fmt = output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt;
739  }
740 
741  ret = init_rescaler(in_pix_fmt, CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->width, CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->height, output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
742  if (ret < 0)
743  {
744  return ret;
745  }
746 
747  if (params.m_deinterlace)
748  {
749  // Init deinterlace filters
750 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
751  AVPixelFormat pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->format);
752 #else
753  AVPixelFormat pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->pix_fmt);
754 #endif
755  ret = init_deinterlace_filters(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
756  if (ret < 0)
757  {
758  return ret;
759  }
760  }
761 
762  m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx = output_codec_ctx;
763  m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = -1;
764  m_out.m_video.m_stream = nullptr;
765 
766  // No audio
767  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
768  m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = -1;
769  m_out.m_audio.m_stream = nullptr;
770 
771  // Open for read/write
772  if (!buffer->open_file(0, CACHE_FLAG_RW))
773  {
774  return AVERROR(EPERM);
775  }
776 
777  // Pre-allocate the predicted file size to reduce memory reallocations
778  size_t buffsize = 600 * 1024 * 1024 /*predicted_filesize() * m_video_frame_count*/;
779  if (buffer->size() < buffsize && !buffer->reserve(buffsize))
780  {
781  int _errno = errno;
782  Logging::error(filename(), "Error pre-allocating %1 bytes buffer: (%2) %3", buffsize, errno, strerror(errno));
783  return AVERROR(_errno);
784  }
785 
786  return 0;
787 }
788 
789 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output(Buffer *buffer)
790 {
791  int ret = 0;
792 
793  m_buffer = buffer;
794 
795  if (!m_out.m_video_pts && is_hls())
796  {
797  m_current_segment = 1;
798  Logging::info(destname(), "Starting HLS segment no. %1.", m_current_segment);
799  }
800 
801  // Open the output file for writing. If buffer == nullptr continue using existing buffer.
802  ret = open_output_filestreams(buffer);
803  if (ret)
804  {
805  return ret;
806  }
807 
808  if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
809  {
810  audio_info(true, m_out.m_format_ctx, m_out.m_audio.m_stream);
811 
812  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
813  {
814  // If not just copying the stream, initialise the FIFO buffer to store audio samples to be encoded.
815  ret = init_fifo();
816  if (ret)
817  {
818  return ret;
819  }
820  }
821  }
822 
823  if (m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1)
824  {
825  video_info(true, m_out.m_format_ctx, m_out.m_video.m_stream);
826  }
827 
828  // Open for read/write
829  if (!buffer->open_file(0, CACHE_FLAG_RW))
830  {
831  return AVERROR(EPERM);
832  }
833 
834  // Pre-allocate the predicted file size to reduce memory reallocations
835  size_t buffsize = predicted_filesize();
836  if (buffer->size() < buffsize && !buffer->reserve(buffsize))
837  {
838  int _errno = errno;
839  Logging::error(filename(), "Error pre-allocating %1 bytes buffer: (%2) %3", buffsize, errno, strerror(errno));
840  return AVERROR(_errno);
841  }
842 
843  return process_output();
844 }
845 
846 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_output()
847 {
848  // Process metadata. The decoder will call the encoder to set appropriate
849  // tag values for the output file.
850  int ret = process_metadata();
851  if (ret)
852  {
853  return ret;
854  }
855 
856  // Write the header of the output file container.
857  ret = write_output_file_header();
858  if (ret)
859  {
860  return ret;
861  }
862 
863  // Process album arts: copy all from source file to target.
864  return process_albumarts();
865 }

867 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_output_sample_rate(int input_sample_rate, int max_sample_rate, int *output_sample_rate /*= nullptr*/)
868 {

870  {
871  if (output_sample_rate != nullptr)
872  {
873  *output_sample_rate = max_sample_rate;
874  }
875  return true;
876  }
877  else
878  {
879  if (output_sample_rate != nullptr)
880  {
881  *output_sample_rate = input_sample_rate;
882  }
883  return false;
884  }
885 }

887 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_output_bit_rate(BITRATE input_bit_rate, BITRATE max_bit_rate, BITRATE * output_bit_rate /*= nullptr*/)
888 {
889  if (input_bit_rate > max_bit_rate)
890  {
891  if (output_bit_rate != nullptr)
892  {
893  *output_bit_rate = max_bit_rate;
894  }
895  return true;
896  }
897  else
898  {
899  if (output_bit_rate != nullptr)
900  {
901  *output_bit_rate = input_bit_rate;
902  }
903  return false;
904  }
905 }
906 
907 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_aspect_ratio(int width, int height, const AVRational & sar, AVRational *ar) const
908 {
909  // Try to determine display aspect ratio
910  AVRational dar;
911  ::av_reduce(&dar.num, &dar.den,
912  width * sar.num,
913  height * sar.den,
914  1024 * 1024);
915 
916  ar->num = ar->den = 0;
917 
918  if (dar.num && dar.den)
919  {
920  *ar = dar;
921  }
922 
923  // If that fails, try sample aspect ratio instead
924  if (!ar->den && sar.num != 0 && sar.den != 0)
925  {
926  *ar = sar;
927  }
928 
929  // If even that fails, try to use video size
930  if (!ar->den && height)
931  {
932  ar->num = width;
933  ar->den = height;
934  }
935 
936  if (!ar->den)
937  {
938  // Return false if all above failed
939  return false;
940  }
941 
942  ::av_reduce(&ar->num, &ar->den,
943  ar->num,
944  ar->den,
945  1024 * 1024);
946 
947  return true;
948 }
949 
950 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_video_size(int *output_width, int *output_height) const
951 {
952  if (!params.m_videowidth && !params.m_videoheight)
953  {
954  // No options, leave as is
955  return false;
956  }
957 
958  int input_width = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->width;
959  int input_height = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->height;
960  AVRational sar = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->sample_aspect_ratio;
961 
962  if (params.m_videowidth && params.m_videoheight)
963  {
964  // Both width/source set. May look strange, but this is an order...
965  *output_width = params.m_videowidth;
966  *output_height = params.m_videoheight;
967  }
968  else if (params.m_videowidth)
969  {
970  // Only video width
971  AVRational ar;
972 
973  *output_width = params.m_videowidth;
974 
975  if (!get_aspect_ratio(input_width, input_height, sar, &ar))
976  {
977  *output_height = input_height;
978  }
979  else
980  {
981  *output_height = static_cast<int>(params.m_videowidth / av_q2d(ar));
982  *output_height &= ~(static_cast<int>(0x1)); // height must be multiple of 2
983  }
984  }
985  else //if (params.m_videoheight)
986  {
987  // Only video height
988  AVRational ar;
989 
990  if (!get_aspect_ratio(input_width, input_height, sar, &ar))
991  {
992  *output_width = input_width;
993  }
994  else
995  {
996  *output_width = static_cast<int>(params.m_videoheight / av_q2d(ar));
997  *output_width &= ~(static_cast<int>(0x1)); // width must be multiple of 2
998  }
999  *output_height = params.m_videoheight;
1000  }
1001 
1002  return (input_width > *output_width || input_height > *output_height);
1003 }
1004 
1005 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::update_codec(void *opt, LPCPROFILE_OPTION profile_option) const
1006 {
1007  int ret = 0;
1008 
1009  if (profile_option == nullptr)
1010  {
1011  return 0;
1012  }
1013 
1014  for (LPCPROFILE_OPTION p = profile_option; p->m_key != nullptr; p++)
1015  {
1016  Logging::trace(destname(), "Profile codec option -%1%2%3.", p->m_key, *p->m_value ? " " : "", p->m_value);
1017 
1018  ret = av_opt_set_with_check(opt, p->m_key, p->m_value, p->m_flags, destname());
1019  if (ret < 0)
1020  {
1021  break;
1022  }
1023  }
1024  return ret;
1025 }
1026 
1027 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::prepare_codec(void *opt, FILETYPE filetype) const
1028 {
1029  int ret = 0;
1030 
1031  for (int n = 0; m_profile[n].m_profile != PROFILE_INVALID; n++)
1032  {
1033  if (m_profile[n].m_filetype == filetype && m_profile[n].m_profile == params.m_profile)
1034  {
1035  ret = update_codec(opt, m_profile[n].m_option_codec);
1036  break;
1037  }
1038  }
1039 
1040  return ret;
1041 }

1043 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_rescaler(AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt, int in_width, int in_height, AVPixelFormat out_pix_fmt, int out_width, int out_height)
1044 {
1045  if (in_pix_fmt != out_pix_fmt || in_width != out_width || in_height != out_height)
1046  {
1047  // Rescale image if required
1048  if (in_pix_fmt != out_pix_fmt)
1049  {
1050  Logging::trace(destname(), "Initialising pixel format conversion from %1 to %2.", get_pix_fmt_name(in_pix_fmt).c_str(), get_pix_fmt_name(out_pix_fmt).c_str());
1051  }
1052 
1053  if (in_width != out_width || in_height != out_height)
1054  {
1055  Logging::debug(destname(), "Rescaling video size from %1:%2 to %3:%4.",
1056  in_width, in_height,
1057  out_width, out_height);
1058  }
1059 
1060  m_sws_ctx = sws_getContext(
1061  // Source settings
1062  in_width, // width
1063  in_height, // height
1064  in_pix_fmt, // format
1065  // Target settings
1066  out_width, // width
1067  out_height, // height
1068  out_pix_fmt, // format
1069  SWS_FAST_BILINEAR, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr); // Maybe SWS_LANCZOS | SWS_ACCURATE_RND
1070  if (m_sws_ctx == nullptr)
1071  {
1072  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate scaling/conversion context.");
1073  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1074  }
1075  }
1076 
1077  return 0;
1078 }
1079 
1080 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_stream(AVCodecID codec_id)
1081 {
1082  AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1083  AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
1084  AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
1085  AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
1086  int ret;
1087 
1088  // find the encoder
1089  output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(codec_id);
1090  if (output_codec == nullptr)
1091  {
1092  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not find encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1093  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1094  }
1095 
1096  output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, output_codec);
1097  if (output_stream == nullptr)
1098  {
1099  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1100  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1101  }
1102  output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
1103 
1104 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1105  output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
1106  if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
1107  {
1108  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not alloc an encoding context.");
1109  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1110  }
1111 #else
1112  output_codec_ctx = output_stream->codec;
1113 #endif
1114 
1115  switch (output_codec->type)
1116  {
1117  case AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO:
1118  {
1119  BITRATE orig_bit_rate;
1120  int orig_sample_rate;
1121 
1122  // Set the basic encoder parameters
1123  orig_bit_rate = (CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->bit_rate != 0) ? CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
1124  if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, params.m_audiobitrate, &output_codec_ctx->bit_rate))
1125  {
1126  // Limit bit rate
1127  Logging::trace(destname(), "Limiting audio bit rate from %1 to %2.",
1128  format_bitrate(orig_bit_rate).c_str(),
1129  format_bitrate(output_codec_ctx->bit_rate).c_str());
1130  }
1131 
1132  if (params.m_audiochannels > 0 && m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels > params.m_audiochannels)
1133  {
1134  Logging::trace(destname(), "Limiting audio channels from %1 to %2.",
1135  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels,
1136  params.m_audiochannels);
1137  output_codec_ctx->channels = params.m_audiochannels;
1138  }
1139  else
1140  {
1141  output_codec_ctx->channels = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels;
1142  }
1143 
1144  output_codec_ctx->channel_layout = static_cast<uint64_t>(av_get_default_channel_layout(output_codec_ctx->channels));
1145  output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1146  orig_sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1147  if (get_output_sample_rate(CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->sample_rate, params.m_audiosamplerate, &output_codec_ctx->sample_rate))
1148  {
1149  // Limit sample rate
1150  Logging::trace(destname(), "Limiting audio sample rate from %1 to %2.",
1151  format_samplerate(orig_sample_rate).c_str(),
1152  format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1153  orig_sample_rate = output_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1154  }
1155 
1156  if (output_codec->supported_samplerates != nullptr)
1157  {
1158  // Go through supported sample rates and adjust if necessary
1159  bool supported = false;
1160 
1161  for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1162  {
1163  if (output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] == output_codec_ctx->sample_rate)
1164  {
1165  // Is supported
1166  supported = true;
1167  break;
1168  }
1169  }
1170 
1171  if (!supported)
1172  {
1173  int min_samplerate = 0;
1174  int max_samplerate = INT_MAX;
1175 
1176  // Find next lower sample rate in probably unsorted list
1177  for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1178  {
1179  if (min_samplerate <= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] && output_codec_ctx->sample_rate >= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n])
1180  {
1181  min_samplerate = output_codec->supported_samplerates[n];
1182  }
1183  }
1184 
1185  // Find next higher sample rate in probably unsorted list
1186  for (int n = 0; output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] != 0; n++)
1187  {
1188  if (max_samplerate >= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n] && output_codec_ctx->sample_rate <= output_codec->supported_samplerates[n])
1189  {
1190  max_samplerate = output_codec->supported_samplerates[n];
1191  }
1192  }
1193 
1194  if (min_samplerate != 0 && max_samplerate != INT_MAX)
1195  {
1196  // set to nearest value
1197  if (output_codec_ctx->sample_rate - min_samplerate < max_samplerate - output_codec_ctx->sample_rate)
1198  {
1199  output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = min_samplerate;
1200  }
1201  else
1202  {
1203  output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = max_samplerate;
1204  }
1205  }
1206  else if (min_samplerate != 0)
1207  {
1208  // No higher sample rate, use next lower
1209  output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = min_samplerate;
1210  }
1211  else if (max_samplerate != INT_MAX)
1212  {
1213  // No lower sample rate, use higher lower
1214  output_codec_ctx->sample_rate = max_samplerate;
1215  }
1216  else
1217  {
1218  // Should never happen... There must at least be one.
1219  Logging::error(destname(), "Audio sample rate to %1 not supported by codec.", format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1220  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1221  }
1222 
1223  Logging::debug(destname(), "Changed audio sample rate from %1 to %2 because requested value is not supported by codec.",
1224  format_samplerate(orig_sample_rate).c_str(),
1225  format_samplerate(output_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str());
1226  }
1227  }
1228 
1229  if (output_codec->sample_fmts != nullptr)
1230  {
1231  // Check if input sample format is supported and if so, use it (avoiding resampling)
1232  AVSampleFormat input_fmt_planar = av_get_planar_sample_fmt(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt);
1233 
1234  output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE;
1235 
1236  for (int n = 0; output_codec->sample_fmts[n] != -1; n++)
1237  {
1238  AVSampleFormat output_fmt_planar = av_get_planar_sample_fmt(output_codec->sample_fmts[n]);
1239 
1240  if (output_codec->sample_fmts[n] == m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt ||
1241  (input_fmt_planar != AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE &&
1242  input_fmt_planar == output_fmt_planar))
1243  {
1244  output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = output_codec->sample_fmts[n];
1245  break;
1246  }
1247  }
1248 
1249  // If none of the supported formats match use the first supported
1250  if (output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt == AV_SAMPLE_FMT_NONE)
1251  {
1252  output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = output_codec->sample_fmts[0];
1253  }
1254  }
1255  else
1256  {
1257  // If suppported sample formats are unknown simply take input format and cross our fingers it works...
1258  output_codec_ctx->sample_fmt = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt;
1259  }
1260 
1261  // Set the sample rate for the container.
1262  output_stream->time_base.den = output_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
1263  output_stream->time_base.num = 1;
1264  output_codec_ctx->time_base = output_stream->time_base;
1265 
1266 //#if !FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1267  // set -strict -2 for aac (required for FFmpeg 2)
1268  av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "strict", "-2", 0);
1269 
1270  // Allow the use of the experimental AAC encoder
1271  output_codec_ctx->strict_std_compliance = FF_COMPLIANCE_EXPERIMENTAL;
1272 //#endif
1273 
1274  // Set duration as hint for muxer
1275  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1276  {
1277  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1278  }
1279  else if (m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1280  {
1281  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), output_stream->time_base);
1282  }
1283 
1284  //av_dict_set_int(&output_stream->metadata, "DURATION", output_stream->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
1285 
1286  // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
1287  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = output_codec_ctx;
1288  // Save the stream index
1289  m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1290  // Save output audio stream for faster reference
1291  m_out.m_audio.m_stream = output_stream;
1292  break;
1293  }
1294  case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
1295  {
1296  BITRATE orig_bit_rate;
1297 
1298  output_codec_ctx->codec_id = codec_id;
1299 
1300  // Set the basic encoder parameters
1301  orig_bit_rate = (CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->bit_rate != 0) ? CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
1302  if (get_output_bit_rate(orig_bit_rate, params.m_videobitrate, &output_codec_ctx->bit_rate))
1303  {
1304  // Limit sample rate
1305  Logging::trace(destname(), "Limiting video bit rate from %1 to %2.",
1306  format_bitrate(orig_bit_rate).c_str(),
1307  format_bitrate(output_codec_ctx->bit_rate).c_str());
1308  }
1309 
1310  // output_codec_ctx->rc_min_rate = output_codec_ctx->bit_rate * 75 / 100;
1311  // output_codec_ctx->rc_max_rate = output_codec_ctx->bit_rate * 125 / 100;
1312 
1313  // output_codec_ctx->qmin = 1;
1314  // output_codec_ctx->qmax = 31;
1315 
1316  int width = 0;
1317  int height = 0;
1318  if (get_video_size(&width, &height))
1319  {
1320  Logging::trace(destname(), "Changing video size from %1/%2 to %3/%4.", output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height, width, height);
1321  output_codec_ctx->width = width;
1322  output_codec_ctx->height = height;
1323  }
1324  else
1325  {
1326  output_codec_ctx->width = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->width;
1327  output_codec_ctx->height = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->height;
1328  }
1329 
1330 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
1331  video_stream_setup(output_codec_ctx, output_stream, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate);
1332 #else
1333  video_stream_setup(output_codec_ctx, output_stream, m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->framerate);
1334 #endif
1335 
1336  AVRational sample_aspect_ratio = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->sample_aspect_ratio;
1337 
1338  if (output_codec_ctx->codec_id != AV_CODEC_ID_VP9)
1339  {
1340  output_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = sample_aspect_ratio;
1341  CODECPAR(output_stream)->sample_aspect_ratio = sample_aspect_ratio;
1342  }
1343 
1344  else
1345  {
1346  // WebM does not respect the aspect ratio and always uses 1:1 so we need to rescale "manually".
1349  output_codec_ctx->sample_aspect_ratio = { 1, 1 };
1350  CODECPAR(output_stream)->sample_aspect_ratio = { 1, 1 };
1351 
1352  // Make sure we do not zero width
1353  if (sample_aspect_ratio.num && sample_aspect_ratio.den)
1354  {
1355  output_codec_ctx->width = output_codec_ctx->width * sample_aspect_ratio.num / sample_aspect_ratio.den;
1356  }
1357  //output_codec_ctx->height *= sample_aspect_ratio.den;
1358  }
1359 
1360  // Set up optimisations
1361  switch (output_codec_ctx->codec_id)
1362  {
1363  case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
1364  {
1365  ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, m_out.m_filetype);
1366  if (ret < 0)
1367  {
1368  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1369  return ret;
1370  }
1371 
1372  // Set constant rate factor to avoid getting huge result files
1373  // The default is 23, but values between 30..40 create properly sized results. Possible values are 0 (lossless) to 51 (very small but ugly results).
1374  // ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "crf", "36", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
1375  // if (ret < 0)
1376  // {
1377  // Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set 'crf' for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1378  // return ret;
1379  // }
1380 
1381  // Avoid mismatches for H264 and profile
1382  uint8_t *out_val;
1383  ret = av_opt_get(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", 0, &out_val);
1384  if (!ret)
1385  {
1386  if (!strcasecmp(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(out_val), "high"))
1387  {
1388  switch (output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt)
1389  {
1390  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUYV422:
1391  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P:
1392  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ422P:
1393  case AV_PIX_FMT_UYVY422:
1394  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P16LE:
1395  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P16BE:
1396  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P10BE:
1397  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P10LE:
1398  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P9BE:
1399  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P9LE:
1400  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P9BE:
1401  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P9LE:
1402  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P10BE:
1403  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P10LE:
1404  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P16BE:
1405  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P16LE:
1406  case AV_PIX_FMT_NV16:
1407  case AV_PIX_FMT_NV20LE:
1408  case AV_PIX_FMT_NV20BE:
1409  case AV_PIX_FMT_YVYU422:
1410  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA422P:
1411  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P12BE:
1412  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P12LE:
1413  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P14BE:
1414  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV422P14LE:
1415  {
1416  ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", "high422", 0);
1417  if (ret < 0)
1418  {
1419  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile=high422 for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1420  return ret;
1421  }
1422  break;
1423  }
1424  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P:
1425  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVJ444P:
1426  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P16LE:
1427  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P16BE:
1428  case AV_PIX_FMT_RGB444LE:
1429  case AV_PIX_FMT_RGB444BE:
1430  case AV_PIX_FMT_BGR444LE:
1431  case AV_PIX_FMT_BGR444BE:
1432  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P9BE:
1433  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P9LE:
1434  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P10BE:
1435  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P10LE:
1436  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP:
1437  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP9BE:
1438  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP9LE:
1439  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP10BE:
1440  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP10LE:
1441  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP16BE:
1442  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP16LE:
1443  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P9BE:
1444  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P9LE:
1445  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P10BE:
1446  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P10LE:
1447  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P16BE:
1448  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P16LE:
1449  case AV_PIX_FMT_XYZ12LE:
1450  case AV_PIX_FMT_XYZ12BE:
1451  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUVA444P:
1452  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP:
1453  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP16BE:
1454  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRAP16LE:
1455  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P12BE:
1456  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P12LE:
1457  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P14BE:
1458  case AV_PIX_FMT_YUV444P14LE:
1459  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP12BE:
1460  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP12LE:
1461  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP14BE:
1462  case AV_PIX_FMT_GBRP14LE:
1463  case AV_PIX_FMT_AYUV64LE:
1464  case AV_PIX_FMT_AYUV64BE:
1465  {
1466  ret = av_opt_set(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, "profile", "high444", 0);
1467  if (ret < 0)
1468  {
1469  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile=high444 for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1470  return ret;
1471  }
1472  break;
1473  }
1474  default:
1475  {
1476  break;
1477  }
1478  }
1479  }
1480  av_free(out_val);
1481  }
1482  break;
1483  }
1484  case AV_CODEC_ID_VP9:
1485  {
1486  ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_WEBM);
1487  if (ret < 0)
1488  {
1489  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1490  return ret;
1491  }
1492  break;
1493  }
1494  case AV_CODEC_ID_PRORES:
1495  {
1496  ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_PRORES);
1497  if (ret < 0)
1498  {
1499  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1500  return ret;
1501  }
1502 
1503  // 0=‘proxy’,
1504  // 1=‘lt’,
1505  // 2=‘standard’,
1506  // 3=‘hq’
1507  output_codec_ctx->profile = params.m_level;
1508  break;
1509  }
1510  case AV_CODEC_ID_ALAC:
1511  {
1512  ret = prepare_codec(output_codec_ctx->priv_data, FILETYPE_ALAC);
1513  if (ret < 0)
1514  {
1515  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not set profile for %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1516  return ret;
1517  }
1518  break;
1519  }
1520  default:
1521  {
1522  break;
1523  }
1524  }
1525 
1526  // Initialise pixel format conversion and rescaling if necessary
1527 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
1528  AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->format);
1529 #else
1530  AVPixelFormat in_pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->pix_fmt);
1531 #endif
1532  if (in_pix_fmt == AV_PIX_FMT_NONE)
1533  {
1534  // If input's stream pixel format is unknown, use same as output (may not work but at least will not crash FFmpeg)
1535  in_pix_fmt = output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt;
1536  }
1537 
1538  ret = init_rescaler(in_pix_fmt, CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->width, CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->height, output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
1539  if (ret < 0)
1540  {
1541  return ret;
1542  }
1543 
1544 #ifdef _DEBUG
1545  print_stream_info(output_stream);
1546 #endif // _DEBUG
1547 
1548  // Set duration as hint for muxer
1549  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1550  {
1551  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1552  }
1553  else if (m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
1554  {
1555  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_format_ctx->duration, av_get_time_base_q(), output_stream->time_base);
1556  }
1557 
1558  //av_dict_set_int(&output_stream->metadata, "DURATION", output_stream->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
1559 
1560  // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
1561  m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx = output_codec_ctx;
1562  // Save the stream index
1563  m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1564  // Save output video stream for faster reference
1565  m_out.m_video.m_stream = output_stream;
1566  break;
1567  }
1568  default:
1569  break;
1570  }
1571 
1572  // Although docs state this is "Demuxing only", this is actually used by encoders like Matroska/WebM, so we need to set this here.
1573  m_out.m_format_ctx->duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration;
1574 
1575  av_dict_set_int(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, "DURATION", m_out.m_format_ctx->duration, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX);
1576 
1577  // Some formats want stream headers to be separate.
1578  if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_GLOBALHEADER)
1579  {
1580  output_codec_ctx->flags |= AV_CODEC_FLAG_GLOBAL_HEADER;
1581  }
1582 
1583  if (!av_dict_get(opt, "threads", nullptr, 0))
1584  {
1585  Logging::trace(destname(), "Setting threads to auto for codec %1.", get_codec_name(output_codec_ctx->codec_id, false));
1586  av_dict_set_with_check(&opt, "threads", "auto", 0, destname());
1587  }
1588 
1589  // Open the encoder for the audio stream to use it later.
1590  ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
1591  if (ret < 0)
1592  {
1593  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not open %1 output codec %2 (error '%3').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, false), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1594  return ret;
1595  }
1596 
1597  Logging::debug(destname(), "Opened %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3.", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(codec_id, true), output_stream->index);
1598 
1599 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1600  ret = avcodec_parameters_from_context(output_stream->codecpar, output_codec_ctx);
1601  if (ret < 0)
1602  {
1603  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not initialise stream parameters (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1604  return ret;
1605  }
1606 #endif
1607 
1608  return 0;
1609 }
1610 
1611 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_stream_copy(AVCodecID codec_id, AVMediaType codec_type)
1612 {
1613  AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
1614  int ret;
1615 
1616 
1617  output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr);
1618  if (output_stream == nullptr)
1619  {
1620  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(codec_id));
1621  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1622  }
1623  output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
1624 
1625  switch (codec_type)
1626  {
1627  case AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO:
1628  {
1629 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1630 
1631  ret = avcodec_parameters_copy(output_stream->codecpar, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codecpar);
1632  if (ret < 0)
1633  {
1634  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not alloc an encoding context (error '%2').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1635  return ret;
1636  }
1637 #else
1638  AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = output_stream->codec;
1639 
1640  ret = avcodec_copy_context(output_codec_ctx /*output_stream->codec*/, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->codec);
1641  if (ret != 0)
1642  {
1643  return ret;
1644  }
1645 #endif
1646 
1647  // Set the sample rate for the container.
1648  output_stream->time_base = m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base;
1649 
1650  // Set duration as hint for muxer
1651  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1652 
1653  // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
1654  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1655  // Save the stream index
1656  m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1657  // Save output audio stream for faster reference
1658  m_out.m_audio.m_stream = output_stream;
1659  break;
1660  }
1661  case AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO:
1662  {
1663 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1664 
1665  ret = avcodec_parameters_copy(output_stream->codecpar, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar);
1666  if (ret < 0)
1667  {
1668  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not alloc an encoding context (error '%2').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1669  return ret;
1670  }
1671 #else
1672  AVCodecContext *output_codec_ctx = output_stream->codec;
1673 
1674  ret = avcodec_copy_context(output_codec_ctx /*output_stream->codec*/, m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec);
1675  if (ret != 0)
1676  {
1677  return ret;
1678  }
1679 #endif
1680  output_stream->time_base = m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base;
1681 
1682 #ifdef _DEBUG
1683  print_stream_info(output_stream);
1684 #endif // _DEBUG
1685 
1686  // Set duration as hint for muxer
1687  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1688 
1689  // Save the encoder context for easier access later.
1690  m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1691  // Save the stream index
1692  m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1693  // Save output video stream for faster reference
1694  m_out.m_video.m_stream = output_stream;
1695 
1696  break;
1697  }
1698  default:
1699  break;
1700  }
1701 
1702  CODECPAR(output_stream)->codec_tag = 0;
1703 
1704  return 0;
1705 }

1707 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_albumart_stream(const AVCodecContext * input_codec_ctx)
1708 {
1709  AVCodecContext * output_codec_ctx = nullptr;
1710  AVStream * output_stream = nullptr;
1711  const AVCodec * input_codec = input_codec_ctx->codec;
1712  const AVCodec * output_codec = nullptr;
1713  AVDictionary * opt = nullptr;
1714  int ret;
1715 
1716  // find the encoder
1717  output_codec = avcodec_find_encoder(input_codec->id);
1718  if (output_codec == nullptr)
1719  {
1720  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not find encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
1721  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1722  }
1723 
1724  // Must be a video codec
1725  if (output_codec->type != AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO)
1726  {
1727  Logging::error(destname(), "INTERNAL TROUBLE! Encoder '%1' is not a video codec.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
1728  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
1729  }
1730 
1731  output_stream = avformat_new_stream(m_out.m_format_ctx, output_codec);
1732  if (output_stream == nullptr)
1733  {
1734  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate stream for encoder '%1'.", avcodec_get_name(input_codec->id));
1735  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1736  }
1737  output_stream->id = static_cast<int>(m_out.m_format_ctx->nb_streams - 1);
1738 
1739 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1740  output_codec_ctx = avcodec_alloc_context3(output_codec);
1741  if (output_codec_ctx == nullptr)
1742  {
1743  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not alloc an encoding context.");
1744  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1745  }
1746 #else
1747  output_codec_ctx = output_stream->codec;
1748 #endif
1749 
1750  // Ignore missing width/height when adding album arts
1751  m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags |= AVFMT_NODIMENSIONS;
1752 
1753  // This is required for some reason (let encoder decide?)
1754  // If not set, write header will fail!
1755  // output_codec_ctx->codec_tag = 0; //av_codec_get_tag(of->codec_tag, codec->codec_id);
1756 
1757  // output_stream->codec->framerate = { 1, 0 };
1758 
1760  // mp4 album arts do not work with ipod profile. Set mp4.
1761  // if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type != nullptr && (!strcmp(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type, "application/mp4") || !strcmp(m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type, "video/mp4")))
1762  // {
1763  // m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->name = "mp4";
1764  // m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->mime_type = "application/mp4";
1765  // }
1766 
1767  // copy disposition
1768  // output_stream->disposition = input_stream->disposition;
1769  output_stream->disposition = AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC;
1770 
1771  // copy estimated duration as a hint to the muxer
1772  if (output_stream->duration <= 0 && m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration > 0)
1773  {
1774  output_stream->duration = av_rescale_q(m_in.m_audio.m_stream->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, output_stream->time_base);
1775  }
1776 
1777  output_codec_ctx->time_base = { 1, 90000 };
1778  output_stream->time_base = { 1, 90000 };
1779 
1780  output_codec_ctx->pix_fmt = input_codec_ctx->pix_fmt;
1781  output_codec_ctx->width = input_codec_ctx->width;
1782  output_codec_ctx->height = input_codec_ctx->height;
1783 
1784  // Some formats want stream headers to be separate.
1785  if (m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_GLOBALHEADER)
1786  {
1787  output_codec_ctx->flags |= AV_CODEC_FLAG_GLOBAL_HEADER;
1788  }
1789 
1790  // Open the encoder for the audio stream to use it later.
1791  ret = avcodec_open2(output_codec_ctx, output_codec, &opt);
1792  if (ret < 0)
1793  {
1794  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not open %1 output codec %2 for stream #%3 (error '%4').", get_media_type_string(output_codec->type), get_codec_name(input_codec->id, false), output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1795  return ret;
1796  }
1797 
1798  Logging::debug(destname(), "Opened album art output codec %1 for stream #%2 (dimensions %3x%4).", get_codec_name(input_codec->id, true), output_stream->index, output_codec_ctx->width, output_codec_ctx->height);
1799 
1800 #if FFMPEG_VERSION3 // Check for FFmpeg 3
1801  ret = avcodec_parameters_from_context(output_stream->codecpar, output_codec_ctx);
1802  if (ret < 0)
1803  {
1804  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not initialise stream parameters stream #%1 (error '%2').", output_stream->index, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1805  return ret;
1806  }
1807 #endif
1808 
1809  STREAMREF stream;
1810 
1811  stream.m_codec_ctx = output_codec_ctx;
1812  stream.m_stream = output_stream;
1813  stream.m_stream_idx = output_stream->index;
1814 
1815  m_out.m_album_art.push_back(stream);
1816 
1817  return 0;
1818 }

1820 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_albumart_frame(AVStream *output_stream, AVPacket *pkt_in)
1821 {
1822  AVPacket *tmp_pkt;
1823  int ret = 0;
1824 
1825 #if LAVF_DEP_AV_COPY_PACKET
1826  tmp_pkt = av_packet_clone(pkt_in);
1827  if (tmp_pkt == nullptr)
1828  {
1829  ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1830  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write album art packet (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1831  return ret;
1832  }
1833 #else
1834  AVPacket pkt;
1835 
1836  tmp_pkt = &pkt;
1837 
1838  ret = av_copy_packet(tmp_pkt, pkt_in);
1839  if (ret < 0)
1840  {
1841  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write album art packet (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
1842  return ret;
1843  }
1844 #endif
1845 
1846  Logging::trace(destname(), "Adding album art stream #%u.", output_stream->index);
1847 
1848  tmp_pkt->stream_index = output_stream->index;
1849  tmp_pkt->flags |= AV_PKT_FLAG_KEY;
1850  tmp_pkt->pos = 0;
1851  tmp_pkt->dts = 0;
1852 
1853  ret = store_packet(tmp_pkt, "album art");
1854 
1855 #if LAVF_DEP_AV_COPY_PACKET
1856  av_packet_unref(tmp_pkt);
1857 #else
1858  av_free_packet(tmp_pkt);
1859 #endif
1860 
1861  return ret;
1862 }
1863 
1864 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::open_output_filestreams(Buffer *buffer)
1865 {
1866  int ret = 0;
1867 
1868  m_out.m_filetype = m_current_format->filetype();
1869 
1870  Logging::debug(destname(), "Opening format type '%1'.", m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
1871 
1872  // Check if we can copy audio or video.
1873  m_copy_audio = can_copy_stream(m_in.m_audio.m_stream);
1874  m_copy_video = can_copy_stream(m_in.m_video.m_stream);
1875 
1876  // Create a new format context for the output container format.
1877  if (m_current_format->format_name() != "m4a")
1878  {
1879  avformat_alloc_output_context2(&m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr, m_current_format->format_name().c_str(), nullptr);
1880  }
1881  else
1882  {
1883  avformat_alloc_output_context2(&m_out.m_format_ctx, nullptr, nullptr, ".m4a");
1884  }
1885 
1886  if (m_out.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
1887  {
1888  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate output format context.");
1889  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1890  }
1891 
1892  if (!m_is_video)
1893  {
1894  m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx = INVALID_STREAM;
1895  }
1896 
1897  //video_codec_id = m_out.m_format_ctx->oformat->video_codec;
1898 
1899  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx != INVALID_STREAM && m_current_format->video_codec_id() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
1900  {
1901  if (!m_copy_video)
1902  {
1903  ret = add_stream(m_current_format->video_codec_id());
1904  if (ret < 0)
1905  {
1906  return ret;
1907  }
1908 
1909  if (params.m_deinterlace)
1910  {
1911  // Init deinterlace filters
1912 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
1913  AVPixelFormat pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codecpar->format);
1914 #else
1915  AVPixelFormat pix_fmt = static_cast<AVPixelFormat>(m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->pix_fmt);
1916 #endif
1917  ret = init_deinterlace_filters(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, pix_fmt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
1918  if (ret < 0)
1919  {
1920  return ret;
1921  }
1922  }
1923  }
1924  else
1925  {
1926  Logging::info(filename(), "Copying video stream.");
1927 
1928  ret = add_stream_copy(m_current_format->video_codec_id(), AVMEDIA_TYPE_VIDEO);
1929  if (ret < 0)
1930  {
1931  return ret;
1932  }
1933  }
1934  }
1935 
1936  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx != INVALID_STREAM && m_current_format->audio_codec_id() != AV_CODEC_ID_NONE)
1937  {
1938  if (!m_copy_audio)
1939  {
1940  ret = add_stream(m_current_format->audio_codec_id());
1941  if (ret < 0)
1942  {
1943  return ret;
1944  }
1945  }
1946  else
1947  {
1948  Logging::info(filename(), "Copying audio stream.");
1949 
1950  ret = add_stream_copy(m_current_format->audio_codec_id(), AVMEDIA_TYPE_AUDIO);
1951  if (ret < 0)
1952  {
1953  return ret;
1954  }
1955  }
1956  }
1957 
1958  if (!params.m_noalbumarts)
1959  {
1960  for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size(); n++)
1961  {
1962  //ret = add_albumart_stream(codec_id, m_in.m_aAlbumArt.at(n).m_codec_ctx->pix_fmt);
1963  ret = add_albumart_stream(m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_codec_ctx);
1964  if (ret < 0)
1965  {
1966  return ret;
1967  }
1968  }
1969  }
1970 
1971  const int buf_size = 5*1024*1024;
1972  unsigned char *iobuffer = static_cast<unsigned char *>(av_malloc(buf_size + FF_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE));
1973  if (iobuffer== nullptr)
1974  {
1975  Logging::error(filename(), "Out of memory opening output file: Unable to allocate I/O buffer.");
1976  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
1977  }
1978 
1979  // open the output file
1980  m_out.m_format_ctx->pb = avio_alloc_context(
1981  iobuffer,
1982  buf_size,
1983  1,
1984  static_cast<void *>(buffer),
1985  nullptr, // read not required
1986  output_write, // write
1987  (m_current_format->audio_codec_id() != AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS) ? seek : nullptr); // seek
1988 
1989  m_out.m_audio_pts = m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr ? m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time : 0;
1990  m_out.m_video_pts = m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr ? m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time : 0;
1991  m_out.m_last_mux_dts = AV_NOPTS_VALUE;
1992 
1993  return 0;
1994 }
1995 
1996 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_resampler()
1997 {
1998  // Fail save: if channel layout not known assume mono or stereo
1999  if (!m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2000  {
2001  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout = static_cast<uint64_t>(av_get_default_channel_layout(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels));
2002  }
2003  if (!m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2004  {
2005  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout = AV_CH_LAYOUT_STEREO;
2006  }
2007  // Only initialise the resampler if it is necessary, i.e.,
2008  // if and only if the sample formats differ.
2009  if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt &&
2010  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate &&
2011  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout == m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2012 
2013  {
2014  // Formats are same
2015  close_resample();
2016  return 0;
2017  }
2018 
2019  if (m_audio_resample_ctx == nullptr ||
2020  m_cur_sample_fmt != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt ||
2021  m_cur_sample_rate != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate ||
2022  m_cur_channel_layout != m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout)
2023  {
2024  int ret;
2025 
2026  Logging::debug(destname(), "Creating audio resampler: %1 -> %2 / %3 -> %4 / %5 -> %6.",
2027  get_sample_fmt_name(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2028  get_sample_fmt_name(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt).c_str(),
2029  format_samplerate(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2030  format_samplerate(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate).c_str(),
2031  get_channel_layout_name(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels, m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout).c_str(),
2032  get_channel_layout_name(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels, m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout).c_str());
2033 
2034  close_resample();
2035 
2036  m_cur_sample_fmt = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt;
2037  m_cur_sample_rate = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate;
2038  m_cur_channel_layout = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout;
2039 
2040  // Create a resampler context for the conversion.
2041  // Set the conversion parameters.
2042 #if LAVR_DEPRECATE
2043  m_audio_resample_ctx = swr_alloc_set_opts(nullptr,
2044  static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout),
2045  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2046  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2047  static_cast<int64_t>(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout),
2048  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt,
2049  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate,
2050  0, nullptr);
2051  if (m_audio_resample_ctx == nullptr)
2052  {
2053  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate resample context.");
2054  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2055  }
2056 
2057  // Open the resampler with the specified parameters.
2058  ret = swr_init(m_audio_resample_ctx);
2059  if (ret < 0)
2060  {
2061  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not open resampler context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2062  swr_free(&m_audio_resample_ctx);
2063  m_audio_resample_ctx = nullptr;
2064  return ret;
2065  }
2066 #else
2067  // Create a resampler context for the conversion.
2068  m_audio_resample_ctx = avresample_alloc_context();
2069  if (m_audio_resample_ctx == nullptr)
2070  {
2071  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate resample context.");
2072  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2073  }
2074 
2075  // Set the conversion parameters.
2076  // Default channel layouts based on the number of channels
2077  // are assumed for simplicity (they are sometimes not detected
2078  // properly by the demuxer and/or decoder).
2079 
2080  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "in_channel_layout", av_get_default_channel_layout(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels), 0);
2081  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "out_channel_layout", av_get_default_channel_layout(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels), 0);
2082  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "in_sample_rate", m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate, 0);
2083  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "out_sample_rate", m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_rate, 0);
2084  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "in_sample_fmt", m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt, 0);
2085  av_opt_set_int(m_audio_resample_ctx, "out_sample_fmt", m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt, 0);
2086 
2087  // Open the resampler with the specified parameters.
2088  ret = avresample_open(m_audio_resample_ctx);
2089  if (ret < 0)
2090  {
2091  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not open resampler context (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2092  avresample_free(&m_audio_resample_ctx);
2093  m_audio_resample_ctx = nullptr;
2094  return ret;
2095  }
2096 #endif
2097  }
2098  return 0;
2099 }

2101 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_fifo()

2105  if (m_audio_fifo == nullptr)

2113 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::update_format(AVDictionary** dict, LPCPROFILE_OPTION option) const
2114 {
2115  int ret = 0;
2116 
2117  if (option == nullptr)
2118  {
2119  return 0;
2120  }
2121 
2122  for (LPCPROFILE_OPTION p = option; p->m_key != nullptr; p++)
2123  {
2124  if ((p->m_options & OPT_AUDIO) && m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx != INVALID_STREAM)
2125  {
2126  // Option for audio only, but file contains video stream
2127  continue;
2128  }
2129 
2130  if ((p->m_options & OPT_VIDEO) && m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx == INVALID_STREAM)
2131  {
2132  // Option for video, but file contains no video stream
2133  continue;
2134  }
2135 
2136  Logging::trace(destname(), "Profile format option -%1%2%3.", p->m_key, *p->m_value ? " " : "", p->m_value);
2137 
2138  ret = av_dict_set_with_check(dict, p->m_key, p->m_value, p->m_flags, destname());
2139  if (ret < 0)
2140  {
2141  break;
2142  }
2143  }
2144  return ret;
2145 }
2146 
2147 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::prepare_format(AVDictionary** dict, FILETYPE filetype) const
2148 {
2149  int ret = 0;
2150 
2151  for (int n = 0; m_profile[n].m_profile != PROFILE_INVALID; n++)
2152  {
2153  if (m_profile[n].m_filetype == filetype && m_profile[n].m_profile == params.m_profile)
2154  {
2155  ret = update_format(dict, m_profile[n].m_option_format);
2156  break;
2157  }
2158  }
2159 
2160  if (filetype == FILETYPE_MP4 || filetype == FILETYPE_PRORES || filetype == FILETYPE_TS || filetype == FILETYPE_HLS)
2161  {
2162  // All
2163  av_dict_set_with_check(dict, "flags:a", "+global_header", 0, destname());
2164  av_dict_set_with_check(dict, "flags:v", "+global_header", 0, destname());
2165  }
2166 
2167  return ret;
2168 }
2169 
2170 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::write_output_file_header()
2171 {
2172  AVDictionary* dict = nullptr;
2173  int ret;
2174 
2175  ret = prepare_format(&dict, m_out.m_filetype);
2176  if (ret < 0)
2177  {
2178  return ret;
2179  }
2180 
2181  ret = avformat_write_header(m_out.m_format_ctx, &dict);
2182  if (ret < 0)
2183  {
2184  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write output file header (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2185  return ret;
2186  }
2187 
2188  if (m_out.m_filetype == FILETYPE_WAV)
2189  {
2190  // Insert fake WAV header (fill in size fields with estimated values instead of setting to -1)
2191  AVIOContext * output_io_context = static_cast<AVIOContext *>(m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
2192  Buffer *buffer = static_cast<Buffer *>(output_io_context->opaque);
2193  size_t pos = buffer->tell();
2194  WAV_HEADER wav_header;
2195  WAV_LIST_HEADER list_header;
2196  WAV_DATA_HEADER data_header;
2197 
2198  buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_header), 0, sizeof(WAV_HEADER));
2199  buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&list_header), sizeof(WAV_HEADER), sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER));
2200  buffer->copy(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&data_header), sizeof(WAV_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + list_header.m_data_bytes - 4, sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER));
2201 
2202  wav_header.m_wav_size = static_cast<unsigned int>(predicted_filesize() - 8);
2203  data_header.m_data_bytes = static_cast<unsigned int>(predicted_filesize() - (sizeof(WAV_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER) + list_header.m_data_bytes - 4));
2204 
2205  buffer->seek(0, SEEK_SET);
2206  buffer->write(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&wav_header), sizeof(WAV_HEADER));
2207  buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(sizeof(WAV_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + list_header.m_data_bytes - 4), SEEK_SET);
2208  buffer->write(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(&data_header), sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER));
2209  buffer->seek(static_cast<long>(pos), SEEK_SET);
2210  }
2211 
2212  return 0;
2213 }

2224  }

2237  }
