2241 
2242 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2243 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode(AVCodecContext *avctx, AVFrame *frame, int *got_frame, const AVPacket *pkt) const
2244 {
2245  int ret;
2246 
2247  *got_frame = 0;
2248 
2249  if (pkt != nullptr)
2250  {
2251  ret = avcodec_send_packet(avctx, pkt);
2252  // In particular, we don't expect AVERROR(EAGAIN), because we read all
2253  // decoded frames with avcodec_receive_frame() until done.
2254  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
2255  {
2256  if (pkt->stream_index == m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx && m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
2257  {
2258  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send audio packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", av_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q()), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2259  }
2260  else if (pkt->stream_index == m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx && m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1)
2261  {
2262  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send video packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", av_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q()), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2263  }
2264  else
2265  {
2266  // Should never come here, but what the heck...
2267  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not send packet at PTS=%1 to decoder (error '%2').", pkt->pts, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2268  }
2269  return ret;
2270  }
2271  }
2272 
2273  ret = avcodec_receive_frame(avctx, frame);
2274  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN) && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
2275  {
2276  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not receive packet from decoder (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2277  }
2278 
2279  *got_frame = (ret >= 0) ? 1 : 0;
2280 
2281  return ret;
2282 }
2283 #endif
2284 
2285 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_audio_frame(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded)
2286 {
2287  int data_present = 0;
2288  int ret = 0;
2289 
2290  *decoded = 0;
2291 
2292  // Decode the audio frame stored in the temporary packet.
2293  // The input audio stream decoder is used to do this.
2294  // If we are at the end of the file, pass an empty packet to the decoder
2295  // to flush it.
2296 
2297  // Since FFMpeg version >= 3.2 this is deprecated
2298 #if !LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2299  // Temporary storage of the input samples of the frame read from the file.
2300  AVFrame *frame = nullptr;
2301 
2302  // Initialise temporary storage for one input frame.
2303  ret = init_frame(&frame, filename());
2304  if (ret < 0)
2305  {
2306  return ret;
2307  }
2308 
2309  ret = avcodec_decode_audio4(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, frame, &data_present, pkt);
2310 
2311  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EINVAL))
2312  {
2313  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2314  // unused frame
2315  av_frame_free(&frame);
2316  return ret;
2317  }
2318 
2319  *decoded = ret;
2320  ret = 0;
2321 
2322  {
2323 #else
2324  bool again = false;
2325 
2326  data_present = 0;
2327 
2328  // read all the output frames (in general there may be any number of them)
2329  while (ret >= 0)
2330  {
2331  AVFrame *frame = nullptr;
2332 
2333  // Initialise temporary storage for one input frame.
2334  ret = init_frame(&frame, filename());
2335  if (ret < 0)
2336  {
2337  return ret;
2338  }
2339 
2340  ret = decode(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, frame, &data_present, again ? nullptr : pkt);
2341  if (!data_present)
2342  {
2343  // unused frame
2344  av_frame_free(&frame);
2345  break;
2346  }
2347 
2348  if (ret < 0)
2349  {
2350  // Anything else is an error, report it!
2351  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2352  // unused frame
2353  av_frame_free(&frame);
2354  break;
2355  }
2356 
2357  again = true;
2358 
2359  *decoded += pkt->size;
2360 #endif
2361  // If there is decoded data, convert and store it
2362  if (data_present && frame->nb_samples)
2363  {
2364  // Temporary storage for the converted input samples.
2365  uint8_t **converted_input_samples = nullptr;
2366  int nb_output_samples;
2367 #if LAVR_DEPRECATE
2368  nb_output_samples = (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr) ? swr_get_out_samples(m_audio_resample_ctx, frame->nb_samples) : frame->nb_samples;
2369 #else
2370  nb_output_samples = (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr) ? avresample_get_out_samples(m_audio_resample_ctx, frame->nb_samples) : frame->nb_samples;
2371 #endif
2372 
2373  try
2374  {
2375  // Initialise the resampler to be able to convert audio sample formats.
2376  ret = init_resampler();
2377  if (ret)
2378  {
2379  throw ret;
2380  }
2381 
2382  // Store audio frame
2383  // Initialise the temporary storage for the converted input samples.
2384  ret = init_converted_samples(&converted_input_samples, nb_output_samples);
2385  if (ret < 0)
2386  {
2387  throw ret;
2388  }
2389 
2390  // Convert the input samples to the desired output sample format.
2391  // This requires a temporary storage provided by converted_input_samples.
2392  ret = convert_samples(frame->extended_data, frame->nb_samples, converted_input_samples, &nb_output_samples);
2393  if (ret < 0)
2394  {
2395  throw ret;
2396  }
2397 
2398  // Add the converted input samples to the FIFO buffer for later processing.
2399  ret = add_samples_to_fifo(converted_input_samples, nb_output_samples);
2400  if (ret < 0)
2401  {
2402  throw ret;
2403  }
2404  ret = 0;
2405  }
2406  catch (int _ret)
2407  {
2408  ret = _ret;
2409  }
2410 
2411  if (converted_input_samples != nullptr)
2412  {
2413  av_freep(&converted_input_samples[0]);
2414  av_free(converted_input_samples);
2415  }
2416  }
2417  av_frame_free(&frame);
2418  }
2419  return ret;
2420 }
2421 
2422 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_video_frame(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded)
2423 {
2424  int data_present;
2425  int ret = 0;
2426 
2427  *decoded = 0;
2428 
2429  // NOTE1: some codecs are stream based (mpegvideo, mpegaudio)
2430  // and this is the only method to use them because you cannot
2431  // know the compressed data size before analysing it.
2432 
2433  // BUT some other codecs (msmpeg4, mpeg4) are inherently frame
2434  // based, so you must call them with all the data for one
2435  // frame exactly. You must also initialise 'width' and
2436  // 'height' before initialising them.
2437 
2438  // NOTE2: some codecs allow the raw parameters (frame size,
2439  // sample rate) to be changed at any frame. We handle this, so
2440  // you should also take care of it
2441 
2442  // Since FFMpeg version >= 3.2 this is deprecated
2443 #if !LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2444  // Temporary storage of the input samples of the frame read from the file.
2445  AVFrame *frame = nullptr;
2446 
2447  // Initialise temporary storage for one input frame.
2448  ret = init_frame(&frame, filename());
2449  if (ret < 0)
2450  {
2451  return ret;
2452  }
2453 
2454  ret = avcodec_decode_video2(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, frame, &data_present, pkt);
2455 
2456  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EINVAL))
2457  {
2458  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2459  // unused frame
2460  av_frame_free(&frame);
2461  return ret;
2462  }
2463 
2464  *decoded = ret;
2465  ret = 0;
2466 
2467  {
2468 #else
2469  bool again = false;
2470 
2471  data_present = 0;
2472 
2473  // read all the output frames (in general there may be any number of them)
2474  while (ret >= 0)
2475  {
2476  AVFrame *frame = nullptr;
2477 
2478  // Initialise temporary storage for one input frame.
2479  ret = init_frame(&frame, filename());
2480  if (ret < 0)
2481  {
2482  return ret;
2483  }
2484 
2485  ret = decode(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx, frame, &data_present, again ? nullptr : pkt);
2486  if (!data_present)
2487  {
2488  // unused frame
2489  av_frame_free(&frame);
2490  break;
2491  }
2492 
2493  if (ret < 0)
2494  {
2495  // Anything else is an error, report it!
2496  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2497  // unused frame
2498  av_frame_free(&frame);
2499  break;
2500  }
2501 
2502  again = true;
2503  *decoded += pkt->size;
2504 #endif
2505 
2506  // Sometimes only a few packets contain valid dts/pts/pos data, so we keep it
2507  if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2508  {
2509  int64_t pts = pkt->dts;
2510  if (pts > m_pts)
2511  {
2512  m_pts = pts;
2513  }
2514  }
2515  else if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2516  {
2517  int64_t pts = pkt->pts;
2518  if (pts > m_pts)
2519  {
2520  m_pts = pts;
2521  }
2522  }
2523 
2524  if (pkt->pos > -1)
2525  {
2526  m_pos = pkt->pos;
2527  }
2528 
2529  if (data_present && !(frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_CORRUPT || frame->flags & AV_FRAME_FLAG_DISCARD))
2530  {
2531  frame = send_filters(frame, ret);
2532  if (ret)
2533  {
2534  return ret;
2535  }
2536 
2537  if (m_sws_ctx != nullptr)
2538  {
2539  AVCodecContext *codec_ctx = m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx;
2540 
2541  AVFrame * tmp_frame = alloc_picture(codec_ctx->pix_fmt, codec_ctx->width, codec_ctx->height);
2542  if (tmp_frame == nullptr)
2543  {
2544  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2545  }
2546 
2547  sws_scale(m_sws_ctx,
2548  static_cast<const uint8_t * const *>(frame->data), frame->linesize,
2549  0, frame->height,
2550  tmp_frame->data, tmp_frame->linesize);
2551 
2552  tmp_frame->pts = frame->pts;
2553  tmp_frame->best_effort_timestamp = frame->best_effort_timestamp;
2554 
2555  av_frame_free(&frame);
2556 
2557  frame = tmp_frame;
2558  }
2559 
2560 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
2561  int64_t best_effort_timestamp = frame->best_effort_timestamp;
2562 #else
2563  int64_t best_effort_timestamp = av_frame_get_best_effort_timestamp(frame);
2564 #endif
2565 
2566  if (best_effort_timestamp != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2567  {
2568  frame->pts = best_effort_timestamp;
2569  }
2570 
2571  if (frame->pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2572  {
2573  frame->pts = m_pts;
2574  }
2575 
2576  if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
2577  {
2578  // Rescale to our time base, but only if nessessary
2579  if (frame->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE && (m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base.den != m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base.den || m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base.num != m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base.num))
2580  {
2581  frame->pts = av_rescale_q_rnd(frame->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base, static_cast<AVRounding>(AV_ROUND_NEAR_INF | AV_ROUND_PASS_MINMAX));
2582  }
2583 
2584  frame->quality = m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->global_quality;
2585  }
2586 
2587  if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
2588  {
2589  // Fix for issue #46: bitrate too high.
2590  // Solution found here https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11466184/setting-video-bit-rate-through-ffmpeg-api-is-ignored-for-libx264-codec
2591  // This is permanently used in the current ffmpeg.c code (see commit: e3fb9af6f1353f30855eaa1cbd5befaf06e303b8 Date:Wed Jan 22 15:52:10 2020 +0100)
2592  frame->pts = av_rescale_q(frame->pts, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base);
2593  }
2594 
2595  frame->pict_type = AV_PICTURE_TYPE_NONE; // other than AV_PICTURE_TYPE_NONE causes warnings
2596  m_video_fifo.push(frame);
2597  }
2598  else
2599  {
2600  // unused frame
2601  av_frame_free(&frame);
2602  }
2603  }
2604 
2605  return ret;
2606 }
2607 
2608 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::store_packet(AVPacket *pkt, const char *type)
2609 {
2610  int ret = av_write_frame(m_out.m_format_ctx, pkt);
2611 
2612  if (ret < 0)
2613  {
2614  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write %1 frame (error '%2').", type, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2615  }
2616 
2617  return ret;
2618 }
2619 
2620 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_frame(AVPacket *pkt)
2621 {
2622  int ret = 0;
2623 
2624  if (pkt->stream_index == m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx && m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
2625  {
2626  if (m_reset_pts && pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2627  {
2628  int64_t pts = av_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q());
2629  m_reset_pts = false;
2630 
2631  m_out.m_audio_pts = av_rescale_q(pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
2632  if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
2633  {
2634  m_out.m_video_pts = av_rescale_q(pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
2635  }
2636  }
2637 
2638  if (!m_copy_audio)
2639  {
2640  int decoded = 0;
2641  ret = decode_audio_frame(pkt, &decoded);
2642  }
2643  else
2644  {
2645  pkt->stream_index = m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx;
2646  if (pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2647  {
2648  pkt->pts = av_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, static_cast<AVRounding>(AV_ROUND_NEAR_INF|AV_ROUND_PASS_MINMAX));
2649  }
2650  if (pkt->dts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2651  {
2652  pkt->dts = av_rescale_q_rnd(pkt->dts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, static_cast<AVRounding>(AV_ROUND_NEAR_INF|AV_ROUND_PASS_MINMAX));
2653  }
2654  if (pkt->duration)
2655  {
2656  pkt->duration = static_cast<int>(av_rescale_q(pkt->duration, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base));
2657  }
2658  pkt->pos = -1;
2659 
2660  ret = store_packet(pkt, "audio");
2661  }
2662  }
2663  else if (pkt->stream_index == m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx && (m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1 || is_frameset()))
2664  {
2665  if (m_reset_pts && pkt->pts != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
2666  {
2667  int64_t pts = av_rescale_q(pkt->pts, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q());
2668  m_reset_pts = false;
2669 
2670  if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
2671  {
2672  m_out.m_audio_pts = av_rescale_q(pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
2673  }
2674  m_out.m_video_pts = av_rescale_q(pts, av_get_time_base_q(), m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
2675  }
2676 
2677  if (!m_copy_video)
2678  {
2679  int decoded = 0;
2680  // Mit Fix: DVD OK, einige Blurays (Phil Collins) nicht
2681  // Ohne Fix: alle DVDs kacka, Blurays dafür OK
2682 #ifndef USE_LIBDVD
2683  ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
2684 #else //USE_LIBDVD
2685  if (m_virtualfile->m_type != VIRTUALTYPE_DVD)
2686  {
2687  ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
2688  }
2689  else
2690  {
2691 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2692  int lastret = 0;
2693 #endif
2694  // Can someone tell me why this seems required??? If this is not done some videos become garbled.
2695  do
2696  {
2697  // Decode one frame.
2698  ret = decode_video_frame(pkt, &decoded);
2699 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2700  if ((ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) && ret == lastret) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
2701  {
2702  // If EAGAIN reported twice or stream at EOF
2703  // quit loop, but this is not an error
2704  // (must process all streams).
2705  break;
2706  }
2707 
2708  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
2709  {
2710  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2711  return ret;
2712  }
2713 
2714  lastret = ret;
2715 #else
2716  if (ret < 0)
2717  {
2718  Logging::error(filename(), "Could not decode frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2719  return ret;
2720  }
2721 #endif
2722  pkt->data += decoded;
2723  pkt->size -= decoded;
2724  }
2725 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
2726  while (pkt->size > 0 && (ret == 0 || ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN)));
2727 #else
2728  while (pkt->size > 0);
2729 #endif
2730  ret = 0;
2731  }
2732 #endif // USE_LIBDVD
2733  }
2734  else
2735  {
2736  pkt->stream_index = m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx;
2737  av_packet_rescale_ts(pkt, m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
2738  pkt->pos = -1;
2739 
2740  ret = store_packet(pkt, "video");
2741  }
2742  }
2743  else
2744  {
2745  for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size(); n++)
2746  {
2747  AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
2748 
2749  // AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC streams already processed in process_albumarts()
2750  if (pkt->stream_index == input_stream->index && !(input_stream->disposition & AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC))
2751  {
2752  AVStream *output_stream = m_out.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
2753 
2754  ret = add_albumart_frame(output_stream, pkt);
2755  break;
2756  }
2757  }
2758  }
2759 
2760  if (!params.m_decoding_errors && ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
2761  {
2762  ret = 0;
2763  }
2764 
2765  return ret;
2766 }
2767 
2768 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_converted_samples(uint8_t ***converted_input_samples, int frame_size)
2769 {
2770  int ret;
2771 
2772  // Allocate as many pointers as there are audio channels.
2773  // Each pointer will later point to the audio samples of the corresponding
2774  // channels (although it may be nullptr for interleaved formats).
2775 
2776  *converted_input_samples = static_cast<uint8_t **>(av_calloc(static_cast<size_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels), sizeof(**converted_input_samples)));
2777 
2778  if (*converted_input_samples == nullptr)
2779  {
2780  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate converted input sample pointers.");
2781  return AVERROR(ENOMEM);
2782  }
2783 
2784  // Allocate memory for the samples of all channels in one consecutive
2785  // block for convenience.
2786  ret = av_samples_alloc(*converted_input_samples, nullptr,
2787  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels,
2788  frame_size,
2789  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt, 0);
2790  if (ret < 0)
2791  {
2792  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate converted input samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2793  av_freep(&(*converted_input_samples)[0]);
2794  av_free(*converted_input_samples);
2795  return ret;
2796  }
2797  return 0;
2798 }
2799 
2800 #if LAVR_DEPRECATE
2801 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::convert_samples(uint8_t **input_data, int in_samples, uint8_t **converted_data, int *out_samples)
2802 {
2803  if (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr)
2804  {
2805  int ret;
2806 
2807  // Convert the samples using the resampler.
2808  ret = swr_convert(m_audio_resample_ctx, converted_data, *out_samples, const_cast<const uint8_t **>(input_data), in_samples);
2809  if (ret < 0)
2810  {
2811  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not convert input samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2812  return ret;
2813  }
2814 
2815  *out_samples = ret;
2816  }
2817  else
2818  {
2819  // No resampling, just copy samples
2820  if (!av_sample_fmt_is_planar(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt))
2821  {
2822  memcpy(converted_data[0], input_data[0], static_cast<size_t>(in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt) * m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels));
2823  }
2824  else
2825  {
2826  size_t samples = static_cast<size_t>(in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt));
2827  for (int n = 0; n < m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels; n++)
2828  {
2829  memcpy(converted_data[n], input_data[n], samples);
2830  }
2831  }
2832  }
2833  return 0;
2834 }
2835 #else
2836 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::convert_samples(uint8_t **input_data, const int in_samples, uint8_t **converted_data, int *out_samples)
2837 {
2838  if (m_audio_resample_ctx != nullptr)
2839  {
2840  int ret;
2841 
2842  // Convert the samples using the resampler.
2843  ret = avresample_convert(m_audio_resample_ctx, converted_data, 0, *out_samples, input_data, 0, in_samples);
2844  if (ret < 0)
2845  {
2846  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not convert input samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2847  return ret;
2848  }
2849 
2850  *out_samples = ret;
2851 
2852  // Perform a sanity check so that the number of converted samples is
2853  // not greater than the number of samples to be converted.
2854  // If the sample rates differ, this case has to be handled differently
2855 
2856  if (avresample_available(m_audio_resample_ctx))
2857  {
2858  Logging::error(destname(), "Converted samples left over.");
2859  return AVERROR_EXIT;
2860  }
2861  }
2862  else
2863  {
2864  // No resampling, just copy samples
2865  if (!av_sample_fmt_is_planar(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt))
2866  {
2867  memcpy(converted_data[0], input_data[0], in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt) * m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels);
2868  }
2869  else
2870  {
2871  for (int n = 0; n < m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels; n++)
2872  {
2873  memcpy(converted_data[n], input_data[n], in_samples * av_get_bytes_per_sample(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt));
2874  }
2875  }
2876  }
2877  return 0;
2878 }

2881 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::add_samples_to_fifo(uint8_t **converted_input_samples, int frame_size)
2882 {
2883  int ret;
2884 
2885  // Make the FIFO as large as it needs to be to hold both,
2886  // the old and the new samples.
2887 
2888  ret = av_audio_fifo_realloc(m_audio_fifo, av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) + frame_size);
2889  if (ret < 0)
2890  {
2891  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not reallocate FIFO.");
2892  return ret;
2893  }
2894 
2895  // Store the new samples in the FIFO buffer.
2896  ret = av_audio_fifo_write(m_audio_fifo, reinterpret_cast<void **>(converted_input_samples), frame_size);
2897  if (ret < frame_size)
2898  {
2899  if (ret < 0)
2900  {
2901  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write data to FIFO (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
2902  }
2903  else
2904  {
2905  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write data to FIFO.");
2906  ret = AVERROR_EXIT;
2907  }
2908  return AVERROR_EXIT;
2909  }
2910 
2911  return 0;

2939 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::flush_frames_single(int stream_index, bool use_flush_packet)
2940 {
2941  int ret = 0;
2942 
2943  if (stream_index > INVALID_STREAM)
2944  {
2945  int (FFmpeg_Transcoder::*decode_frame_ptr)(AVPacket *pkt, int *decoded) = nullptr;
2946 
2947  if (!m_copy_audio && stream_index == m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx && m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
2948  {
2949  decode_frame_ptr = &FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_audio_frame;
2950  }
2951  else if (!m_copy_video && stream_index == m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx && (m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1 || is_frameset()))
2952  {
2953  decode_frame_ptr = &FFmpeg_Transcoder::decode_video_frame;
2954  }
2955 
2956  if (decode_frame_ptr != nullptr)
2957  {
2958  AVPacket pkt;
2959  AVPacket *flush_packet = nullptr;
2960  int decoded = 0;
2961 
2962  if (use_flush_packet)
2963  {
2964  flush_packet = &pkt;
2965 
2966  init_packet(flush_packet);
2967 
2968  flush_packet->data = nullptr;
2969  flush_packet->size = 0;
2970  flush_packet->stream_index = stream_index;
2971  }
2972 
2973  do
2974  {
2975  ret = (this->*decode_frame_ptr)(flush_packet, &decoded);
2976  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
2977  {
2978  break;
2979  }
2980  }
2981  while (decoded);
2982 
2983  if (flush_packet != nullptr)
2984  {
2985  av_packet_unref(flush_packet);
2986  }
2987  }
2988  }
2989 
2990  return ret;
2991 }

2993 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::read_decode_convert_and_store(int *finished)
2994 {
2995  // Packet used for temporary storage.
2996  AVPacket pkt;
2997  int ret = 0;
2998 
2999  try
3000  {
3001  // Read one frame from the input file into a temporary packet.
3002  ret = av_read_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, &pkt);
3003  if (ret < 0)
3004  {
3005  if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3006  {
3007  // If we are the the end of the file, flush the decoder below.
3008  *finished = 1;
3009  Logging::trace(destname(), "Read to EOF.");
3010  }
3011  else
3012  {
3013  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not read frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3014  throw ret;
3015  }
3016  }
3017 
3018  if (!*finished)
3019  {
3020  // Decode one packet, at least with the old API (!LAV_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE)
3021  // it seems a packet can contain more than one frame so loop around it
3022  // if necessary...
3023  ret = decode_frame(&pkt);
3024 
3025  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3026  {
3027  throw ret;
3028  }
3029  }
3030  else
3031  {
3032  // Flush cached frames, ignoring any errors
3033  flush_frames_all(true);
3034  }
3035 
3036  ret = 0; // Errors will be reported by exception
3037  }
3038  catch (int _ret)
3039  {
3040  ret = _ret;
3041  }
3042 
3043  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3044 
3045  return ret;
3046 }

3048 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_audio_output_frame(AVFrame **frame, int frame_size)
3049 {
3050  int ret;
3051 
3052  // Create a new frame to store the audio samples.
3053  *frame = av_frame_alloc();
3054  if (*frame == nullptr)
3055  {
3056  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not allocate output frame.");
3057  return AVERROR_EXIT;
3058  }
3059 
3060  //
3061  // Set the frame's parameters, especially its size and format.
3062  // av_frame_get_buffer needs this to allocate memory for the
3063  // audio samples of the frame.
3064  // Default channel layouts based on the number of channels
3065  // are assumed for simplicity.
3066 
3067  (*frame)->nb_samples = frame_size;
3068  (*frame)->channel_layout = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channel_layout;
3069  (*frame)->format = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->sample_fmt;
3070 
3071  // Allocate the samples of the created frame. This call will make
3072  // sure that the audio frame can hold as many samples as specified.
3073 
3074  ret = av_frame_get_buffer(*frame, 32);
3075  if (ret < 0)
3076  {
3077  Logging::error(destname(), "Could allocate output frame samples (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3078  av_frame_free(frame);
3079  return ret;
3080  }
3081 
3082  return 0;
3083 }

3085 void FFmpeg_Transcoder::produce_audio_dts(AVPacket *pkt)
3086 {
3087  // if ((pkt->pts == 0 || pkt->pts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE) && pkt->dts == AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3088  {
3089  int64_t duration;
3090  // Some encoders to not produce dts/pts.
3091  // So we make some up.
3092  if (pkt->duration)
3093  {
3094  duration = pkt->duration;
3095 
3096  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS || m_current_format->filetype() == FILETYPE_TS || m_current_format->filetype() == FILETYPE_HLS)
3097  {
3104  if (duration > 0 && CODECPAR(m_out.m_audio.m_stream)->sample_rate > 0)
3105  {
3106  pkt->duration = duration = static_cast<int>(av_rescale(duration, static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base.den) * m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->ticks_per_frame, CODECPAR(m_out.m_audio.m_stream)->sample_rate * static_cast<int64_t>(m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base.num)));
3107  }
3108  }
3109  }
3110  else
3111  {
3112  duration = 1;
3113  }
3114 
3115  pkt->dts = m_out.m_audio_pts - 1;
3116  pkt->pts = m_out.m_audio_pts;
3117 
3118  m_out.m_audio_pts += duration;
3119  }
3120 }

3122 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_audio_frame(const AVFrame *frame, int *data_present)
3123 {
3124  // Packet used for temporary storage.
3125  AVPacket pkt;
3126  int ret;
3127 
3128  init_packet(&pkt);
3129 
3130  // Encode the audio frame and store it in the temporary packet.
3131  // The output audio stream encoder is used to do this.
3132 #if !LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3133  ret = avcodec_encode_audio2(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, &pkt, frame, data_present);
3134 
3135  if (ret < 0)
3136  {
3137  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3138  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3139  return ret;
3140  }
3141 
3142  {
3143 #else
3144  *data_present = 0;
3145 
3146  // send the frame for encoding
3147  ret = avcodec_send_frame(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, frame);
3148  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR_EOF)
3149  {
3150  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame at PTS=%1 (error %2').", av_rescale_q(frame->pts, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q()), ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3151  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3152  return ret;
3153  }
3154 
3155  // read all the available output packets (in general there may be any number of them)
3156  while (ret >= 0)
3157  {
3158  *data_present = 0;
3159 
3160  ret = avcodec_receive_packet(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx, &pkt);
3161  if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3162  {
3163  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3164  return ret;
3165  }
3166  else if (ret < 0)
3167  {
3168  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3169  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3170  return ret;
3171  }
3172 
3173  *data_present = 1;
3174 #endif
3175  // Write one audio frame from the temporary packet to the output buffer.
3176  if (*data_present)
3177  {
3178  pkt.stream_index = m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx;
3179 
3180  produce_audio_dts(&pkt);
3181 
3182  ret = store_packet(&pkt, "audio");
3183  if (ret < 0)
3184  {
3185  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3186  return ret;
3187  }
3188  }
3189 
3190  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3191  }
3192 
3193  return 0;

3300  if (frame != nullptr)

3349  throw ret;

3376  av_packet_rescale_ts(&pkt, m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx->time_base, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
3377

3399

3426  if (ret < 0)
3427  {
3428  throw ret;
3429  }
3430  }
3431 
3432  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3433  }
3434  }
3435  catch (int _ret)
3436  {
3437  av_packet_unref(&pkt);
3438  ret = _ret;
3439  }
3440 
3441  return ret;
3442 }
3443 
3444 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::load_encode_and_write(int frame_size)
3445 {
3446  // Temporary storage of the output samples of the frame written to the file.
3447  AVFrame *output_frame;
3448  int ret = 0;
3449 
3450  // Use the maximum number of possible samples per frame.
3451  // If there is less than the maximum possible frame size in the FIFO
3452  // buffer use this number. Otherwise, use the maximum possible frame size
3453 
3454  frame_size = FFMIN(av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo), frame_size);
3455  int data_written;
3456 
3457  // Initialise temporary storage for one output frame.
3458  ret = init_audio_output_frame(&output_frame, frame_size);
3459  if (ret < 0)
3460  {
3461  return ret;
3462  }
3463 
3464  // Read as many samples from the FIFO buffer as required to fill the frame.
3465  // The samples are stored in the frame temporarily.
3466 
3467  ret = av_audio_fifo_read(m_audio_fifo, reinterpret_cast<void **>(output_frame->data), frame_size);
3468  if (ret < frame_size)
3469  {
3470  if (ret < 0)
3471  {
3472  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not read data from FIFO (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3473  }
3474  else
3475  {
3476  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not read data from FIFO.");
3477  ret = AVERROR_EXIT;
3478  }
3479  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
3480  return ret;
3481  }
3482 
3483  // Encode one frame worth of audio samples.
3484  ret = encode_audio_frame(output_frame, &data_written);
3485 #if !LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3486  if (ret < 0)
3487 #else
3488  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3489 #endif
3490  {
3491  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
3492  return ret;
3493  }
3494  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
3495  return 0;
3496 }

3501 
3502  ret = av_write_trailer(m_out.m_format_ctx);
3503  if (ret < 0)
3504  {
3505  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not write output file trailer (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3506  return ret;
3507  }
3508 
3509  return 0;

3517 #define tagcpy(dst, src) \
3518  for (char *p1 = (dst), *pend = p1 + sizeof(dst), *p2 = (src); *p2 && p1 < pend; p1++, p2++) \
3519  *p1 = *p2
3521 void FFmpeg_Transcoder::copy_metadata(AVDictionary **metadata_out, const AVDictionary *metadata_in)
3522 {
3523  AVDictionaryEntry *tag = nullptr;
3524 
3525  while ((tag = av_dict_get(metadata_in, "", tag, AV_DICT_IGNORE_SUFFIX)))
3526  {
3527  av_dict_set_with_check(metadata_out, tag->key, tag->value, 0, destname());
3528 
3529  if (m_out.m_filetype == FILETYPE_MP3)
3530  {
3531  // For MP3 fill in ID3v1 structure
3532  if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "ARTIST"))
3533  {
3534  tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_artist, tag->value);
3535  }
3536  else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TITLE"))
3537  {
3538  tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_title, tag->value);
3539  }
3540  else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "ALBUM"))
3541  {
3542  tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_album, tag->value);
3543  }
3544  else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "COMMENT"))
3545  {
3546  tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_comment, tag->value);
3547  }
3548  else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "YEAR") || !strcasecmp(tag->key, "DATE"))
3549  {
3550  tagcpy(m_out.m_id3v1.m_year, tag->value);
3551  }
3552  else if (!strcasecmp(tag->key, "TRACK"))
3553  {
3554  m_out.m_id3v1.m_title_no = static_cast<char>(atoi(tag->value));
3555  }
3556  }
3557  }
3558 }

3560 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_metadata()
3561 {
3562  Logging::trace(destname(), "Processing metadata.");
3563 
3564  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->codec_id == AV_CODEC_ID_VORBIS)
3565  {
3566  // For some formats (namely ogg) FFmpeg returns the tags, odd enough, with streams...
3567  copy_metadata(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->metadata);
3568  }
3569 
3570  copy_metadata(&m_out.m_format_ctx->metadata, m_in.m_format_ctx->metadata);
3571 
3572  if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
3573  {
3574  // Copy audio stream meta data
3575  copy_metadata(&m_out.m_audio.m_stream->metadata, m_in.m_audio.m_stream->metadata);
3576  }
3577 
3578  if (m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
3579  {
3580  // Copy video stream meta data
3581  copy_metadata(&m_out.m_video.m_stream->metadata, m_in.m_video.m_stream->metadata);
3582  }
3583 
3584  // Also copy album art meta tags
3585  for (size_t n = 0; n < m_in.m_album_art.size(); n++)
3586  {
3587  AVStream *input_stream = m_in.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
3588  AVStream *output_stream = m_out.m_album_art.at(n).m_stream;
3589 
3590  copy_metadata(&output_stream->metadata, input_stream->metadata);
3591  }
3592

3594 }

3631 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::do_seek_frame(uint32_t frame_no)
3632 {
3633  m_have_seeked = true; // Note that we have seeked, thus skipped frames. We need to start transcoding over to fill any gaps.
3634 
3635  //m_skip_next_frame = true; /**< @todo: Take deinterlace into account */
3636 
3637  if (m_skip_next_frame)
3638  {
3639  --frame_no;
3640  }
3641 
3642  int64_t pts = frame_to_pts(m_in.m_video.m_stream, frame_no);
3643 
3644  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3645  {
3646  pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
3647  }
3648 
3649  return av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
3650 }
3651 
3652 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::skip_decoded_frames(uint32_t frame_no, bool forced_seek)
3653 {
3654  int ret = 0;
3655  uint32_t next_frame_no = frame_no;
3656  // Seek next undecoded frame
3657  for (; m_buffer->have_frame(next_frame_no); next_frame_no++)
3658  {
3659  sleep(0);
3660  }
3661 
3662  if (next_frame_no > m_virtualfile->m_video_frame_count)
3663  {
3664  // Reached end of file
3665  // Set PTS to end of file
3666  m_out.m_video_pts = m_in.m_video.m_stream->duration;
3667  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3668  {
3669  m_out.m_video_pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
3670  }
3671  // Seek to end of file to force AVERROR_EOF from next av_read_frame() call.
3672  ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, m_out.m_video_pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_ANY);
3673  return 0;
3674  }
3675 
3676  uint32_t last_frame_no = pts_to_frame(m_in.m_video.m_stream, m_out.m_video_pts);
3677 
3678  // Ignore seek if target is within the next FRAME_SEEK_THRESHOLD frames
3679  if (next_frame_no >= last_frame_no /*+ 1*/ && next_frame_no <= last_frame_no + FRAME_SEEK_THRESHOLD)
3680  {
3681  return 0;
3682  }
3683 
3684  if (forced_seek || (frame_no != next_frame_no && next_frame_no > 1))
3685  {
3686  // If frame changed, skip to it
3687  ret = do_seek_frame(next_frame_no);
3688 
3689  if (ret < 0)
3690  {
3691  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame: Seek to frame #%1 failed (error '%2').", next_frame_no, ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3692  }
3693  }
3694 
3695  return ret;
3696 }
3697 
3698 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::process_single_fr(int &status)
3699 {
3700  int finished = 0;
3701  int ret = 0;
3702 
3703  status = 0;
3704 
3705  try
3706  {
3707  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && is_frameset())
3708  {
3709  // Direct access handling for frame sets: seek to frame if requested.
3710  if (!m_last_seek_frame_no)
3711  {
3712  // No current seek frame, check if new seek frame was stacked.
3713  {
3714  std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lck (m_mutex);
3715 
3716  while (!m_seek_to_fifo.empty())
3717  {
3718  uint32_t frame_no = m_seek_to_fifo.front();
3719  m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
3720 
3721  if (!m_buffer->have_frame(frame_no))
3722  {
3723  // Frame not yet decoded, so skip to it.
3724  m_last_seek_frame_no = frame_no;
3725  break;
3726  }
3727  }
3728  }
3729 
3730  if (m_last_seek_frame_no)
3731  {
3732  // The first frame that FFmpeg API returns after av_seek_frame is wrong (the last frame before seek).
3733  // We are unable to detect that because the pts seems correct (the one that we requested).
3734  // So we position before the frame requested, and simply throw the first away.
3735 
3736  //#define PRESCAN_FRAMES 3
3737 #ifdef PRESCAN_FRAMES
3738  int64_t seek_frame_no = m_last_seek_frame_noX;
3739  if (seek_frame_no > PRESCAN_FRAMES)
3740  {
3741  seek_frame_no -= PRESCAN_FRAMES;
3742  //m_skip_next_frame = true; /**< @todo: Take deinterlace into account */
3743  }
3744  else
3745  {
3746  seek_frame_no = 1;
3747  }
3748 
3749  ret = skip_decoded_frames(seek_frame_no, true);
3750 #else
3751  ret = skip_decoded_frames(m_last_seek_frame_no, true);
3752 #endif
3753 
3754  if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3755  {
3756  status = 1;
3757  return 0;
3758  }
3759 
3760  if (ret < 0)
3761  {
3762  throw ret;
3763  }
3764  }
3765  }
3766  }
3767 
3768  if (!m_copy_audio && m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
3769  {
3770  int output_frame_size;
3771 
3772  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->codec->capabilities & AV_CODEC_CAP_VARIABLE_FRAME_SIZE)
3773  {
3774  // Encode supports variable frame size, use an arbitrary value
3775  output_frame_size = 10000;
3776  }
3777  else
3778  {
3779  // Use the encoder's desired frame size for processing.
3780  output_frame_size = m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->frame_size;
3781  }
3782 
3783  // Make sure that there is one frame worth of samples in the FIFO
3784  // buffer so that the encoder can do its work.
3785  // Since the decoder's and the encoder's frame size may differ, we
3786  // need to FIFO buffer to store as many frames worth of input samples
3787  // that they make up at least one frame worth of output samples.
3788 
3789  while (av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) < output_frame_size)
3790  {
3791  // Decode one frame worth of audio samples, convert it to the
3792  // output sample format and put it into the FIFO buffer.
3793 
3794  ret = read_decode_convert_and_store(&finished);
3795  if (ret < 0)
3796  {
3797  throw ret;
3798  }
3799 
3800  // If we are at the end of the input file, we continue
3801  // encoding the remaining audio samples to the output file.
3802 
3803  if (finished)
3804  {
3805  break;
3806  }
3807  }
3808 
3809  // If we have enough samples for the encoder, we encode them.
3810  // At the end of the file, we pass the remaining samples to
3811  // the encoder.
3812 
3813  while (av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) >= output_frame_size || (finished && av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo) > 0))
3814  {
3815  // Take one frame worth of audio samples from the FIFO buffer,
3816  // encode it and write it to the output file.
3817 
3818  ret = load_encode_and_write(output_frame_size);
3819  if (ret < 0)
3820  {
3821  throw ret;
3822  }
3823  }
3824 
3825  // If we are at the end of the input file and have encoded
3826  // all remaining samples, we can exit this loop and finish.
3827 
3828  if (finished)
3829  {
3830  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
3831  {
3832  // Flush the encoder as it may have delayed frames.
3833  int data_written = 0;
3834  do
3835  {
3836  ret = encode_audio_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
3837 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3838  if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3839  {
3840  // Not an error
3841  break;
3842  }
3843 
3844  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3845  {
3846  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3847  throw ret;
3848  }
3849 #else
3850  if (ret < 0)
3851  {
3852  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode audio frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3853  throw ret;
3854  }
3855 #endif
3856  }
3857  while (data_written);
3858  }
3859 
3860  status = 1;
3861  }
3862  }
3863  else
3864  {
3865  // If we have no audio stream, we'll only get video data
3866  // or we simply copy audio and/or video frames into the packet queue
3867  ret = read_decode_convert_and_store(&finished);
3868  if (ret < 0)
3869  {
3870  throw ret;
3871  }
3872 
3873  if (finished)
3874  {
3875  status = 1;
3876  }
3877  }
3878 
3879  if (!m_copy_video)
3880  {
3881  while (!m_video_fifo.empty())
3882  {
3883  AVFrame *output_frame = m_video_fifo.front();
3884  m_video_fifo.pop();
3885 
3886  // Encode one video frame.
3887  int data_written = 0;
3888  output_frame->key_frame = 0; // Leave that decision to encoder
3889  output_frame->pict_type = AV_PICTURE_TYPE_NONE;
3890 
3891  if (!is_frameset())
3892  {
3893  ret = encode_video_frame(output_frame, &data_written);
3894  }
3895  else
3896  {
3897  ret = encode_image_frame(output_frame, &data_written);
3898  }
3899 #if !LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3900  if (ret < 0)
3901 #else
3902  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3903 #endif
3904  {
3905  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
3906  throw ret;
3907  }
3908  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
3909  }
3910 
3911 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3912  ret = 0; // May be AVERROR(EAGAIN)
3913 #endif
3914 
3915  // If we are at the end of the input file and have encoded
3916  // all remaining samples, we can exit this loop and finish.
3917 
3918  if (finished)
3919  {
3920  if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
3921  {
3922  // Flush the encoder as it may have delayed frames.
3923  int data_written = 0;
3924  do
3925  {
3926  if (!is_frameset())
3927  {
3928  // Encode regluar frame
3929  ret = encode_video_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
3930  }
3931  else
3932  {
3933  // Encode seperate image frame
3934  ret = encode_image_frame(nullptr, &data_written);
3935  }
3936 #if LAVC_NEW_PACKET_INTERFACE
3937  if (ret == AVERROR_EOF)
3938  {
3939  // Not an error
3940  break;
3941  }
3942  if (ret < 0 && ret != AVERROR(EAGAIN))
3943  {
3944  Logging::error(destname(), "Could not encode video frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
3945  throw ret;
3946  }
3947 #else
3948  if (ret < 0)
3949  {
3950  throw ret;
3951  }
3952 #endif
3953  }
3954  while (data_written);
3955  }
3956 
3957  status = 1;
3958  }
3959  }
3960 
3961  if (is_hls())
3962  {
3963  uint32_t next_segment;
3964  int64_t pos = 0;
3965  if (m_out.m_video_pts && m_in.m_video.m_stream != nullptr && m_out.m_video.m_stream != nullptr)
3966  {
3967  int64_t pts = m_out.m_video_pts;
3968 
3969  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3970  {
3971  pts -= m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
3972  }
3973 
3974  pos = av_rescale_q(pts, m_out.m_video.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q());
3975  }
3976  else if (m_out.m_audio_pts && m_in.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr && m_out.m_audio.m_stream != nullptr)
3977  {
3978  int64_t pts = m_out.m_audio_pts;
3979 
3980  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
3981  {
3982  pts -= m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time;
3983  }
3984  pos = av_rescale_q(pts, m_out.m_audio.m_stream->time_base, av_get_time_base_q());
3985  }
3986 
3987  next_segment = static_cast<uint32_t>(pos / params.m_segment_duration + 1); // ????
3988 
3989  if (next_segment > m_virtualfile->get_segment_count())
3990  {
3991  Logging::error(destname(), "Requested position %1 or segment %2 exceeds segment count %3.", format_duration(pos).c_str(), next_segment, m_virtualfile->get_segment_count());
3992  throw AVERROR(ESPIPE);
3993  }
3994  else if (next_segment == m_current_segment + 1)
3995  {
3996  bool opened = false;
3997 
3998  encode_finish();
3999 
4000  // Go to next requested segment
4001  while (!m_seek_to_fifo.empty())
4002  {
4003  uint32_t segment_no = m_seek_to_fifo.front();
4004  m_seek_to_fifo.pop();
4005 
4006  if (!m_buffer->segment_exists(segment_no) || !m_buffer->tell(segment_no)) // NOT EXISTS or NO DATA YET
4007  {
4008  m_reset_pts = true; // Note that we have to reset audio/video pts to the new position
4009  m_have_seeked = true; // Note that we have seeked, thus skipped frames. We need to start transcoding over to fill any gaps.
4010 
4011  int64_t pos = (segment_no - 1) * params.m_segment_duration;
4012 
4013  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx && m_out.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1)
4014  {
4015  int64_t pts = av_rescale_q(pos, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_video.m_stream->time_base);
4016 
4017  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4018  {
4019  pts += m_in.m_video.m_stream->start_time;
4020  }
4021 
4022  ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx, pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
4023  }
4024  else // if (m_out.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
4025  {
4026  int64_t pts = av_rescale_q(pos, av_get_time_base_q(), m_in.m_audio.m_stream->time_base);
4027 
4028  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4029  {
4030  pts += m_in.m_audio.m_stream->start_time;
4031  }
4032 
4033  ret = av_seek_frame(m_in.m_format_ctx, m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx, pts, AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD);
4034  }
4035 
4036  if (ret < 0)
4037  {
4038  Logging::error(destname(), "Seek failed on input file (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4039  throw ret;
4040  }
4041 
4042  if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
4043  {
4044  avcodec_flush_buffers(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx);
4045  }
4046 
4047  if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx != nullptr)
4048  {
4049  avcodec_flush_buffers(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx);
4050  }
4051 
4052  close_output_file();
4053 
4054  open_output(m_buffer);
4055 
4056  next_segment = segment_no;
4057 
4058  opened = true;
4059 
4060  break;
4061  }
4062  }
4063 
4064  m_current_segment = next_segment;
4065 
4066  Logging::info(destname(), "Starting HLS segment no. %1.", m_current_segment);
4067 
4068  if (!m_buffer->set_segment(m_current_segment))
4069  {
4070  throw AVERROR(errno);
4071  }
4072 
4073  if (!opened)
4074  {
4075  // Process output file, already done by open_output() if file has been newly opened.
4076  ret = process_output();
4077  if (ret)
4078  {
4079  throw ret;
4080  }
4081  }
4082  }
4083  }
4084  }
4085  catch (int _ret)
4086  {
4087  status = -1;
4088  return _ret;
4089  }
4090 
4091  return 0;
4092 }
4093 
4094 BITRATE FFmpeg_Transcoder::get_prores_bitrate(int width, int height, const AVRational &framerate, int interleaved, int profile)
4095 {
4096  unsigned int mindist;
4097  int match = -1;
4098 
4099  // Find best match resolution
4100  mindist = UINT_MAX;
4101  for (int i = 0; m_prores_bitrate[i].m_width; i++)
4102  {
4103  unsigned int x = static_cast<unsigned int>(width - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_width);
4104  unsigned int y = static_cast<unsigned int>(height - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_height);
4105  unsigned int dist = (x * x) + (y * y);
4106 
4107  if (dist < mindist)
4108  {
4109  mindist = dist;
4110  match = i;
4111  }
4112 
4113  if (!dist)
4114  {
4115  // Exact match, won't find a better one.
4116  break;
4117  }
4118  }
4119 
4120  width = m_prores_bitrate[match].m_width;
4121  height = m_prores_bitrate[match].m_height;
4122 
4123  // Find best match framerate
4124  double framerateX = av_q2d(framerate);
4125  mindist = UINT_MAX;
4126  for (int i = match; width == m_prores_bitrate[i].m_width && height == m_prores_bitrate[i].m_height; i++)
4127  {
4128  unsigned int dist = UINT_MAX;
4129  for (int j = 0; j < MAX_PRORES_FRAMERATE && m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_framerate; j++)
4130  {
4131  unsigned int x = static_cast<unsigned int>(framerateX - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_framerate);
4132  unsigned int y = static_cast<unsigned int>(interleaved - m_prores_bitrate[i].m_framerate[j].m_interleaved);
4133 
4134  dist = (x * x) + (y * y);
4135 
4136  if (dist < mindist)
4137  {
4138  mindist = dist;
4139  match = i;
4140  }
4141 
4142  if (!dist)
4143  {
4144  // Exact match, won't find a better one.
4145  break;
4146  }
4147  }
4148 
4149  if (!dist)
4150  {
4151  // Exact match, won't find a better one.
4152  break;
4153  }
4154  }
4155 
4156  if (match < 0)
4157  {
4158  return 0;
4159  }
4160 
4161  return m_prores_bitrate[match].m_bitrate[profile] * (1000 * 1000);
4162 }
4163 
4164 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::audio_size(size_t *filesize, AVCodecID codec_id, BITRATE bit_rate, int64_t duration, int channels, int sample_rate)
4165 {
4166  BITRATE output_audio_bit_rate;
4167  int output_sample_rate;
4168  bool success = true;
4169 
4170  get_output_bit_rate(bit_rate, params.m_audiobitrate, &output_audio_bit_rate);
4171  get_output_sample_rate(sample_rate, params.m_audiosamplerate, &output_sample_rate);
4172 
4173  switch (codec_id)
4174  {
4175  case AV_CODEC_ID_AAC:
4176  {
4177  // Try to predict the size of the AAC stream (this is fairly accurate, sometimes a bit larger, sometimes a bit too small
4178  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4179  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 2.5% for overhead
4180  break;
4181  }
4182  case AV_CODEC_ID_MP3:
4183  {
4184  // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
4185  // This is the sum of the size of
4186  // ID3v2, ID3v1, and raw MP3 data. This is theoretically only approximate
4187  // but in practice gives excellent answers, usually exactly correct.
4188  // Cast to 64-bit int to avoid overflow.
4189 
4190  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE)) + ID3V1_TAG_LENGTH;
4191  break;
4192  }
4193  case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16LE:
4194  case AV_CODEC_ID_PCM_S16BE:
4195  {
4196  // bits_per_sample = av_get_bits_per_sample(ctx->codec_id);
4197  // bit_rate = bits_per_sample ? ctx->sample_rate * (int64_t)ctx->channels * bits_per_sample : ctx->bit_rate;
4198 
4199  int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16);
4200 
4201  // File size:
4202  // file duration * sample rate (HZ) * channels * bytes per sample
4203  // + WAV_HEADER + DATA_HEADER + (with FFMpeg always) LIST_HEADER
4204  // The real size of the list header is unkown as we don't know the contents (meta tags)
4205  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels > 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE) + sizeof(WAV_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_LIST_HEADER) + sizeof(WAV_DATA_HEADER);
4206  break;
4207  }
4208  case AV_CODEC_ID_VORBIS:
4209  {
4210  // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
4211  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4212  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 2.5% for overhead
4213  break;
4214  }
4215  case AV_CODEC_ID_OPUS:
4216  {
4217  // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
4218  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4219  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1150 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 15% for overhead
4220  break;
4221  }
4222  case AV_CODEC_ID_ALAC:
4223  {
4224  int bytes_per_sample = av_get_bytes_per_sample(AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S16);
4225 
4226  // File size:
4227  // Apple Lossless Audio Coding promises a compression rate of 60-70%. We estimate 65 % of the original WAV size.
4228  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * sample_rate * (channels > 2 ? 2 : 1) * bytes_per_sample / AV_TIME_BASE) * 100 / 65;
4229  break;
4230  }
4231  case AV_CODEC_ID_AC3:
4232  {
4233  // Kbps = bits per second / 8 = Bytes per second x 60 seconds = Bytes per minute x 60 minutes = Bytes per hour
4234  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * output_audio_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4235  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1150 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 15% for overhead
4236  break;
4237  }
4238  case AV_CODEC_ID_NONE:
4239  {
4240  break;
4241  }
4242  default:
4243  {
4244  success = false;
4245  break;
4246  }
4247  }
4248  return success;
4249 }
4250 
4251 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::video_size(size_t *filesize, AVCodecID codec_id, BITRATE bit_rate, int64_t duration, int width, int height, int interleaved, const AVRational &framerate)
4252 {
4253  BITRATE out_video_bit_rate;
4254  bool success = true;
4255 
4256  get_output_bit_rate(bit_rate, params.m_videobitrate, &out_video_bit_rate);
4257 
4258  switch (codec_id)
4259  {
4260  case AV_CODEC_ID_H264:
4261  {
4262  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4263  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1100 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 10.0% for overhead
4264  break;
4265  }
4266  case AV_CODEC_ID_THEORA:
4267  {
4268  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4269  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1025 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 2.5% for overhead
4270  break;
4271  }
4272  case AV_CODEC_ID_VP9:
4273  {
4274  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * out_video_bit_rate / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4275  *filesize = static_cast<size_t>(1150 * (*filesize) / 1000); // add 15% for overhead
4276  break;
4277  }
4278  case AV_CODEC_ID_PRORES:
4279  {
4280  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(duration * get_prores_bitrate(width, height, framerate, interleaved, params.m_level) / (8LL * AV_TIME_BASE));
4281  break;
4282  }
4283  case AV_CODEC_ID_PNG:
4284  case AV_CODEC_ID_BMP:
4285  case AV_CODEC_ID_MJPEG:
4286  {
4287  *filesize += static_cast<size_t>(width * height * 24 / 8); // Get the max. size
4288  break;
4289  }
4290  case AV_CODEC_ID_NONE:
4291  {
4292  break;
4293  }
4294  default:
4295  {
4296  success = false;
4297  break;
4298  }
4299  }
4300  return success;
4301 }

4303 size_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::calculate_predicted_filesize() const
4304 {
4305  if (m_in.m_format_ctx == nullptr)
4306  {
4307  return 0;
4308  }
4309 
4310  if (m_current_format == nullptr)
4311  {
4312  // Should ever happen, but better check this to avoid crashes.
4313  return 0;
4314  }
4315 
4316  size_t filesize = 0;
4317 
4318  int64_t duration = m_in.m_format_ctx->duration != AV_NOPTS_VALUE ? m_in.m_format_ctx->duration : 0;
4319  BITRATE input_audio_bit_rate = 0;
4320  int input_sample_rate = 0;
4321  BITRATE input_video_bit_rate = 0;
4322 
4323  if (m_fileio->duration() != AV_NOPTS_VALUE)
4324  {
4325  duration = m_fileio->duration();
4326  }
4327 
4328  if (m_in.m_audio.m_stream_idx > -1)
4329  {
4330  input_sample_rate = CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->sample_rate;
4331  input_audio_bit_rate = (CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->bit_rate != 0) ? CODECPAR(m_in.m_audio.m_stream)->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
4332  }
4333 
4334  if (m_in.m_video.m_stream_idx > -1)
4335  {
4336  input_video_bit_rate = (CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->bit_rate != 0) ? CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->bit_rate : m_in.m_format_ctx->bit_rate;
4337  }
4338 
4339  if (input_audio_bit_rate)
4340  {
4341  int channels = m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx->channels;
4342 
4343  if (!audio_size(&filesize, m_current_format->audio_codec_id(), input_audio_bit_rate, duration, channels, input_sample_rate))
4344  {
4345  Logging::warning(filename(), "Unsupported audio codec '%1' for format %2.", get_codec_name(m_current_format->audio_codec_id(), 0), m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
4346  }
4347  }
4348 
4349  if (input_video_bit_rate)
4350  {
4351  if (m_is_video)
4352  {
4353  int width = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->width;
4354  int height = CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->height;
4355  int interleaved = params.m_deinterlace ? 0 : (CODECPAR(m_in.m_video.m_stream)->field_order != AV_FIELD_PROGRESSIVE); // Deinterlace only if source is interlaced
4356 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
4357  AVRational framerate = m_in.m_video.m_stream->avg_frame_rate;
4358 #else
4359  AVRational framerate = m_in.m_video.m_stream->codec->framerate;
4360 #endif
4361  if (!video_size(&filesize, m_current_format->video_codec_id(), input_video_bit_rate, duration, width, height, interleaved, framerate))
4362  {
4363  Logging::warning(filename(), "Unsupported video codec '%1' for format %2.", get_codec_name(m_current_format->video_codec_id(), 0), m_current_format->desttype().c_str());
4364  }
4365  }
4366  // else /** @todo: Feature #2260: Add picture size */
4367  // {
4368  // }
4369  }
4370 
4371  return filesize;
4372 }

4422 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::encode_finish()
4423 {
4424  int ret = 0;
4425  if (!is_frameset())
4426  {
4427  // If not a frame set, write trailer
4428 
4429  // Write the trailer of the output file container.
4430  ret = write_output_file_trailer();
4431  }
4432 
4433  if (is_hls())
4434  {
4435  m_buffer->finished_segment();
4436 
4437  // Get segment VIRTUALFILE object
4438  std::string filename(m_buffer->virtualfile()->m_origfile + "/" + make_filename(m_current_segment, params.current_format(m_buffer->virtualfile())->fileext()));
4439  LPVIRTUALFILE virtualfile = find_file(filename.c_str());
4440 
4441  if (virtualfile != nullptr)
4442  {
4443  virtualfile->m_predicted_size = m_buffer->buffer_watermark(m_current_segment);
4444 #if defined __x86_64__ || !defined __USE_FILE_OFFSET64
4445  virtualfile->m_st.st_size = static_cast<__off_t>(virtualfile->m_predicted_size);
4446 #else
4447  virtualfile->m_st.st_size = static_cast<__off64_t>(virtualfile->m_predicted_size);
4448 #endif
4449  virtualfile->m_st.st_blocks = (virtualfile->m_st.st_size + 512 - 1) / 512;
4450  }
4451  }
4452 
4453  return ret;
4454 }

4461 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::input_read(void * opaque, unsigned char * data, int size)
4462 {
4463  FileIO * io = static_cast<FileIO *>(opaque);
4464 
4465  if (io == nullptr)
4466  {
4467  Logging::error(nullptr, "input_read(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
4468  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4469  }
4470 
4471  if (io->eof())
4472  {
4473  // At EOF
4474  return AVERROR_EOF;
4475  }
4476 
4477  int read = static_cast<int>(io->read(reinterpret_cast<char *>(data), static_cast<size_t>(size)));
4478 
4479  if (read != size && io->error())
4480  {
4481  // Read failed
4482  return AVERROR(io->error());
4483  }
4484 
4485  return read;
4486 }

4488 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::output_write(void * opaque, unsigned char * data, int size)
4489 {
4490  Buffer * buffer = static_cast<Buffer *>(opaque);
4491 
4492  if (buffer == nullptr)
4493  {
4494  Logging::error(nullptr, "input_write(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
4495  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4496  }
4497 
4498  int written = static_cast<int>(buffer->write(static_cast<const uint8_t*>(data), static_cast<size_t>(size)));
4499  if (written != size)
4500  {
4501  // Write error
4502  return (AVERROR(errno));
4503  }
4504  return written;
4505 }

4507 int64_t FFmpeg_Transcoder::seek(void * opaque, int64_t offset, int whence)
4508 {
4509  FileIO * io = static_cast<FileIO *>(opaque);
4510  int64_t res_offset = 0;
4511 
4512  if (io == nullptr)
4513  {
4514  Logging::error(nullptr, "seek(): Internal error: FileIO is NULL!");
4515  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
4516  }
4517 
4518  if (whence & AVSEEK_SIZE)
4519  {
4520  // Return file size
4521  res_offset = static_cast<int64_t>(io->size());
4522  }
4523  else
4524  {
4525  whence &= ~(AVSEEK_SIZE | AVSEEK_FORCE);
4526 
4527  if (!io->seek(offset, whence))
4528  {
4529  // OK: Return position
4530  res_offset = offset;
4531  }
4532  else
4533  {
4534  // Error
4535  res_offset = AVERROR(errno);
4536  }
4537  }
4538 
4539  return res_offset;
4540 }

4559 void FFmpeg_Transcoder::purge_fifos()
4560 {
4561  std::string outfile;
4562  int audio_samples_left = 0;
4563  size_t video_frames_left = 0;
4564 
4565  if (m_audio_fifo != nullptr)
4566  {
4567  audio_samples_left = av_audio_fifo_size(m_audio_fifo);
4568  av_audio_fifo_free(m_audio_fifo);
4569  m_audio_fifo = nullptr;
4570  }
4571 
4572  video_frames_left = m_video_fifo.size();
4573 
4574  while (m_video_fifo.size())
4575  {
4576  AVFrame *output_frame = m_video_fifo.front();
4577  m_video_fifo.pop();
4578 
4579  av_frame_free(&output_frame);
4580  }
4581 
4582  if (m_out.m_format_ctx != nullptr)
4583  {
4584 #if LAVF_DEP_FILENAME
4585  if (m_out.m_format_ctx->url != nullptr)
4586  {
4587  outfile = m_out.m_format_ctx->url;
4588  }
4589 #else
4590  // lavf 58.7.100 - avformat.h - deprecated
4591  outfile = m_out.m_format_ctx->filename;
4592 #endif
4593  }
4594 
4595  const char *p = outfile.empty() ? nullptr : outfile.c_str();
4596  if (audio_samples_left)
4597  {
4598  Logging::warning(p, "%1 audio samples left in buffer and not written to target file!", audio_samples_left);
4599  }
4600 
4601  if (video_frames_left)
4602  {
4603  Logging::warning(p, "%1 video frames left in buffer and not written to target file!", video_frames_left);
4604  }
4605 }

4607 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::close_output_file()
4608 {
4609  bool closed = false;
4610 
4611  purge_fifos();
4612 
4613  if (close_resample())
4614  {
4615  closed = true;
4616  }
4617 
4618  if (m_sws_ctx != nullptr)
4619  {
4620  sws_freeContext(m_sws_ctx);
4621  m_sws_ctx = nullptr;
4622  closed = true;
4623  }
4624 
4625  // Close output file
4626 #if !LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
4627  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx)
4628  {
4629  avcodec_close(m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx);
4630  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4631  closed = true;
4632  }
4633 
4634  if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx)
4635  {
4636  avcodec_close(m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx);
4637  m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4638  closed = true;
4639  }
4640 #else
4641  if (m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx)
4642  {
4643  avcodec_free_context(&m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx);
4644  m_out.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4645  closed = true;
4646  }
4647 
4648  if (m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx)
4649  {
4650  avcodec_free_context(&m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx);
4651  m_out.m_video.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4652  closed = true;
4653  }
4654 #endif
4655 
4656  while (m_out.m_album_art.size())
4657  {
4658  AVCodecContext *codec_ctx = m_out.m_album_art.back().m_codec_ctx;
4659  m_out.m_album_art.pop_back();
4660  if (codec_ctx != nullptr)
4661  {
4662 #if !LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
4663  avcodec_close(codec_ctx);
4664 #else
4665  avcodec_free_context(&codec_ctx);
4666 #endif
4667  closed = true;
4668  }
4669  }
4670 
4671  if (m_out.m_format_ctx != nullptr)
4672  {
4673  if (m_out.m_format_ctx->pb != nullptr)
4674  {
4675  // 2017-09-01 - xxxxxxx - lavf 57.80.100 / 57.11.0 - avio.h
4676  // Add avio_context_free(). From now on it must be used for freeing AVIOContext.
4677 #if (LIBAVFORMAT_VERSION_INT >= AV_VERSION_INT(57, 80, 0))
4678  av_freep(&m_out.m_format_ctx->pb->buffer);
4679  avio_context_free(&m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
4680 #else
4681  av_freep(m_out.m_format_ctx->pb);
4682 #endif
4683  m_out.m_format_ctx->pb = nullptr;
4684  }
4685 
4686  avformat_free_context(m_out.m_format_ctx);
4687 
4688  m_out.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
4689  closed = true;
4690  }
4691 
4692  return closed;
4693 }
4694 
4695 bool FFmpeg_Transcoder::close_input_file()
4696 {
4697  bool closed = false;
4698 
4699 #if !LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
4700  if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx)
4701  {
4702  avcodec_close(m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx);
4703  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4704  closed = true;
4705  }
4706 
4707  if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx)
4708  {
4709  avcodec_close(m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx);
4710  m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4711  closed = true;
4712  }
4713 #else
4714  if (m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx)
4715  {
4716  avcodec_free_context(&m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx);
4717  m_in.m_audio.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4718  closed = true;
4719  }
4720 
4721  if (m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx)
4722  {
4723  avcodec_free_context(&m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx);
4724  m_in.m_video.m_codec_ctx = nullptr;
4725  closed = true;
4726  }
4727 #endif
4728 
4729  while (m_in.m_album_art.size())
4730  {
4731  AVCodecContext *codec_ctx = m_in.m_album_art.back().m_codec_ctx;
4732  m_in.m_album_art.pop_back();
4733  if (codec_ctx != nullptr)
4734  {
4735 #if !LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
4736  avcodec_close(codec_ctx);
4737 #else
4738  avcodec_free_context(&codec_ctx);
4739 #endif
4740  closed = true;
4741  }
4742  }
4743 
4744  if (m_in.m_format_ctx != nullptr)
4745  {
4746  //if (!(m_in.m_format_ctx->oformat->flags & AVFMT_NOFILE))
4747  {
4748  if (m_close_fileio && m_fileio != nullptr)
4749  {
4750  m_fileio->close();
4751  delete m_fileio;
4752  m_fileio = nullptr;
4753  }
4754 
4755  if (m_in.m_format_ctx->pb != nullptr)
4756  {
4757  // 2017-09-01 - xxxxxxx - lavf 57.80.100 / 57.11.0 - avio.h
4758  // Add avio_context_free(). From now on it must be used for freeing AVIOContext.
4759 #if (LIBAVFORMAT_VERSION_INT >= AV_VERSION_INT(57, 80, 0))
4760  avio_context_free(&m_in.m_format_ctx->pb);
4761 #else
4762  av_freep(m_in.m_format_ctx->pb);
4763 #endif
4764  m_in.m_format_ctx->pb = nullptr;
4765  }
4766  }
4767 
4768  avformat_close_input(&m_in.m_format_ctx);
4769  m_in.m_format_ctx = nullptr;
4770  closed = true;
4771  }
4772 
4773  free_filters();
4774 
4775  return closed;
4776 }
4777 
4778 void FFmpeg_Transcoder::close()
4779 {
4780  bool closed = false;
4781 
4782  // Close input file
4783  closed |= close_input_file();
4784 
4785  // Close output file
4786  closed |= close_output_file();
4787 
4788  if (closed)
4789  {
4790  // Closed anything (anything had been open to be closed in the first place)...
4791  Logging::trace(nullptr, "FFmpeg transcoder closed.");
4792  }
4793 }

4805 // create
4806 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::init_deinterlace_filters(AVCodecContext *codec_context, AVPixelFormat pix_fmt, const AVRational & avg_frame_rate, const AVRational & time_base)
4807 {
4808  const char * filters;
4809  char args[1024];
4810  const AVFilter * buffer_src = avfilter_get_by_name("buffer");
4811  const AVFilter * buffer_sink = avfilter_get_by_name("buffersink");
4812  AVFilterInOut * outputs = avfilter_inout_alloc();
4813  AVFilterInOut * inputs = avfilter_inout_alloc();
4814  //enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmts[] = { AV_PIX_FMT_GRAY8, AV_PIX_FMT_NONE };
4815  int ret = 0;
4816 
4817  m_buffer_sink_context = nullptr;
4818  m_buffer_source_context = nullptr;
4819  m_filter_graph = nullptr;
4820 
4821  try
4822  {
4823  if (!avg_frame_rate.den && !avg_frame_rate.num)
4824  {
4825  // No framerate, so this video "stream" has only one picture
4826  throw static_cast<int>(AVERROR(EINVAL));
4827  }
4828 
4829  m_filter_graph = avfilter_graph_alloc();
4830 
4831  AVBufferSinkParams buffer_sink_params;
4832  enum AVPixelFormat pixel_fmts[3];
4833 
4834  if (outputs == nullptr || inputs == nullptr || m_filter_graph == nullptr)
4835  {
4836  throw static_cast<int>(AVERROR(ENOMEM));
4837  }
4838 
4839  // buffer video source: the decoded frames from the decoder will be inserted here.
4840  snprintf(args, sizeof(args), "video_size=%dx%d:pix_fmt=%d:time_base=%d/%d:pixel_aspect=%d/%d",
4841  codec_context->width, codec_context->height, pix_fmt,
4842  time_base.num, time_base.den,
4843  codec_context->sample_aspect_ratio.num, FFMAX(codec_context->sample_aspect_ratio.den, 1));
4844 
4845  //AVRational fr = av_guess_frame_rate(m_m_out.m_format_ctx, m_pVideoStream, nullptr);
4846  //if (fr.num && fr.den)
4847  //{
4848  // av_strlcatf(buffersrc_args, sizeof(buffersrc_args), ":framerate=%d/%d", fr.num, fr.den);
4849  //}
4850  //
4851  //args.snprintf("%d:%d:%d:%d:%d", m_pCodecContext->width, m_pCodecContext->height, m_pCodecContext->format, 0, 0); // 0, 0 ok?
4852 
4853  ret = avfilter_graph_create_filter(&m_buffer_source_context, buffer_src, "in", args, nullptr, m_filter_graph);
4854  if (ret < 0)
4855  {
4856  Logging::error(destname(), "Cannot create buffer source (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4857  throw ret;
4858  }
4859 
4860  //av_opt_set(m_pBufferSourceContext, "thread_type", "slice", AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
4861  //av_opt_set_int(m_pBufferSourceContext, "threads", FFMAX(1, av_cpu_count()), AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
4862  //av_opt_set_int(m_pBufferSourceContext, "threads", 16, AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
4863 
4864  // buffer video sink: to terminate the filter chain.
4865 
4866  if (pix_fmt == AV_PIX_FMT_NV12)
4867  {
4868  pixel_fmts[0] = AV_PIX_FMT_NV12;
4869  pixel_fmts[1] = AV_PIX_FMT_YUV420P;
4870  }
4871 
4872  else
4873  {
4874  pixel_fmts[0] = pix_fmt;
4875  pixel_fmts[1] = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
4876  }
4877 
4878  pixel_fmts[2] = AV_PIX_FMT_NONE;
4879 
4880  buffer_sink_params.pixel_fmts = pixel_fmts;
4881 
4882  ret = avfilter_graph_create_filter(&m_buffer_sink_context, buffer_sink, "out", nullptr, &buffer_sink_params, m_filter_graph);
4883 
4884  if (ret < 0)
4885  {
4886  Logging::error(destname(), "Cannot create buffer sink (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4887  throw ret;
4888  }
4889 
4890  // Cannot change FFmpeg's API, so we hide this warning
4891 #pragma GCC diagnostic push
4892 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
4893 #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wsign-conversion"
4894  ret = av_opt_set_int_list(m_buffer_sink_context, "pix_fmts", pixel_fmts, AV_PIX_FMT_NONE, AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN);
4895 #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
4896 
4897  if (ret < 0)
4898  {
4899  Logging::error(nullptr, "Cannot set output pixel format (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4900  throw ret;
4901  }
4902 
4903  // Endpoints for the filter graph.
4904  outputs->name = av_strdup("in");
4905  outputs->filter_ctx = m_buffer_source_context;
4906  outputs->pad_idx = 0;
4907  outputs->next = nullptr;
4908  inputs->name = av_strdup("out");
4909  inputs->filter_ctx = m_buffer_sink_context;
4910  inputs->pad_idx = 0;
4911  inputs->next = nullptr;
4912 
4913  // args "null" passthrough (dummy) filter for video
4914  // args "anull" passthrough (dummy) filter for audio
4915 
4916  // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31163120/c-applying-filter-in-ffmpeg
4917  //filters = "yadif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=interlaced";
4918  filters = "yadif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=all";
4919  //filters = "yadif=0:-1:0";
4920  //filters = "bwdif=mode=send_frame:parity=auto:deint=all";
4921  //filters = "kerndeint=thresh=10:map=0:order=0:sharp=1:twoway=1";
4922  //filters = "zoompan=z='min(max(zoom,pzoom)+0.0015,1.5)':d=1:x='iw/2-(iw/zoom/2)':y='ih/2-(ih/zoom/2)'";
4923 
4924  ret = avfilter_graph_parse_ptr(m_filter_graph, filters, &inputs, &outputs, nullptr);
4925  if (ret < 0)
4926  {
4927  Logging::error(destname(), "avfilter_graph_parse_ptr failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4928  throw ret;
4929  }
4930 
4931  ret = avfilter_graph_config(m_filter_graph, nullptr);
4932  if (ret < 0)
4933  {
4934  Logging::error(destname(), "avfilter_graph_config failed (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4935  throw ret;
4936  }
4937 
4938  Logging::debug(destname(), "Deinterlacing initialised with filters '%1'.", filters);
4939  }
4940  catch (int _ret)
4941  {
4942  ret = _ret;
4943  }
4944 
4945  if (inputs != nullptr)
4946  {
4947  avfilter_inout_free(&inputs);
4948  }
4949  if (outputs != nullptr)
4950  {
4951  avfilter_inout_free(&outputs);
4952  }
4953 
4954  return ret;
4955 }
4956 
4957 AVFrame *FFmpeg_Transcoder::send_filters(AVFrame * srcframe, int & ret)
4958 {
4959  AVFrame *tgtframe = srcframe;
4960 
4961  ret = 0;
4962 
4963  if (m_buffer_source_context != nullptr /*&& srcframe->interlaced_frame*/)
4964  {
4965  try
4966  {
4967  AVFrame * filterframe = nullptr;
4968 
4969  //pFrame->pts = av_frame_get_best_effort_timestamp(pFrame);
4970  // push the decoded frame into the filtergraph
4971 
4972  if ((ret = ::av_buffersrc_add_frame_flags(m_buffer_source_context, srcframe, AV_BUFFERSRC_FLAG_KEEP_REF)) < 0)
4973  {
4974  Logging::warning(destname(), "Error while feeding the frame to filtergraph (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4975  throw ret;
4976  }
4977 
4978  filterframe = ::av_frame_alloc();
4979  if (filterframe == nullptr)
4980  {
4981  ret = AVERROR(ENOMEM);
4982  Logging::error(destname(), "Unable to allocate filter frame (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4983  throw ret;
4984  }
4985 
4986  // pull filtered frames from the filtergraph
4987  ret = ::av_buffersink_get_frame(m_buffer_sink_context, filterframe);
4988  if (ret == AVERROR(EAGAIN) || ret == AVERROR_EOF)
4989  {
4990  // Not an error, go on
4991  ::av_frame_free(&filterframe);
4992  ret = 0;
4993  }
4994  else if (ret < 0)
4995  {
4996  Logging::error(destname(), "Error while getting frame from filtergraph (error '%1').", ffmpeg_geterror(ret).c_str());
4997  ::av_frame_free(&filterframe);
4998  throw ret;
4999  }
5000  else
5001  {
5002  // All OK; copy filtered frame and unref original
5003  tgtframe = filterframe;
5004 
5005  tgtframe->pts = srcframe->pts;
5006 #if LAVF_DEP_AVSTREAM_CODEC
5007  tgtframe->best_effort_timestamp = srcframe->best_effort_timestamp;
5008 #else
5009  tgtframe->best_effort_timestamp = av_frame_get_best_effort_timestamp(srcframe);
5010 #endif
5011  ::av_frame_free(&srcframe);
5012  }
5013  }
5014  catch (int _ret)
5015  {
5016  ret = _ret;
5017  }
5018  }
5019 
5020  return tgtframe;
5021 }
5022

5024 
5025 void FFmpeg_Transcoder::free_filters()
5026 {
5027  if (m_buffer_sink_context != nullptr)
5028  {
5029  ::avfilter_free(m_buffer_sink_context);
5030  m_buffer_sink_context = nullptr;
5031  }
5032 
5033  if (m_buffer_source_context != nullptr)
5034  {
5035  ::avfilter_free(m_buffer_source_context);
5036  m_buffer_source_context = nullptr;
5037  }
5038 
5039  if (m_filter_graph != nullptr)
5040  {
5041  ::avfilter_graph_free(&m_filter_graph);
5042  m_filter_graph = nullptr;
5043  }
5044 }

5046 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::stack_seek_frame(uint32_t frame_no)
5047 {
5048  if (frame_no > 0 && frame_no <= video_frame_count())
5049  {
5050  std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lck (m_mutex);
5051  m_seek_to_fifo.push(frame_no); // Seek to this frame next decoding operation
5052  return 0;
5053  }
5054  else
5055  {
5056  errno = EINVAL;
5057  Logging::error(destname(), "stack_seek_frame() failed: Frame %1 was requested, but is out of range (1...%2)", frame_no, video_frame_count() + 1);
5058  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
5059  }
5060 }
5061 
5062 int FFmpeg_Transcoder::stack_seek_segment(uint32_t segment_no)
5063 {

5065  {
5066  std::lock_guard<std::recursive_mutex> lck (m_mutex);
5067  m_seek_to_fifo.push(segment_no); // Seek to this segment next decoding operation
5068  return 0;
5069  }
5070  else
5071  {
5072  errno = EINVAL;
5073  Logging::error(destname(), "stack_seek() failed: Segment %1 was requested, but is out of range (1...%2)", segment_no, video_frame_count() + 1);
5074  return AVERROR(EINVAL);
5075  }
5076 }
